name: Como Park Zoo & Conservatory
address: 1225 Estabrook Dr, St Paul, MN 55103, USA
reviews: Beautiful zoo and conservatory. They have a great and varied collection of animals. Nice indoor areas, as well. The Conservatory took my breath away. Nice to see so much green after all the snow outside.

Nice day out, beautiful  conservatory and plants. Also for just a small donation you can visit the zoo  - well worth  a visit and very interesting and knowledgeable staff. Would definitely recommend if in the area.
Great place to take the Family without breaking the bank. We have a one year old that loves looking at the animals. For a donation only zoo it's more than I expected. Clean and well laid out.

Como is a Twin Cities treasure. An awesome (FREE!) activity any time of year, with lots of animal exhibits outdoors in the summer, and the conservatory offering a tropical escape into lush greenery and warmth even on the coldest snowy days in winter. The unexpected sloth hanging out in the tropical bird conservatory is one of my favorite spots to visit. The bonsai tree has an open section in winter, expanded in summer with a Japanese garden outside as well. Como is great for whole families, a date, catching up with friends , or getting your grandparents out for the day. Also a great spot for photo sessions; saw one today for a quinceañera!

It is a smaller zoo, but a great way to spend an hour or so.  It was cold when I last went here, so I did not have much interaction with staff.  There were a couple spaces under construction as well.  It is definitely a family-friendly place.  I highly recommend taking your kids here if you do not want to chaos or expense of the state zoo.

name: Cathedral of Saint Paul
address: 239 Selby Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
My GREAT GREAT GRANDPARENTS WERE MARRIED HERE IN 1920....
Not to mention you can go in anytime just to experience the beauty and complete awesomeness of a place of worship. I truly feel like one of God's children when I am here🕊💖

Truly beautiful, yet not excessive. The sound system is excellent (difficult to accomplish in such a massive space). The parish community and priest are absolutely centered on Christ and His gospel.

Not particularly strong on handicap accessibility.

A majestic, ornate and classically domed cathedral, strikingly visible on the Saint Paul skyline, impressively massive by day and highlighted with breathtaking lights by night. The altar, with its elaborate sculpted bronze canopy, is reminiscent of the altar in Saint Peter's Basilica in the Vatican  On the highest hilltop overlooking Minnesota's Capitol city, it was 51 years from start of construction to consecration. In spite of its huge dome and vast size, acoustics are excellent for worship services and the Gallery organ marvelously fills the monumental space.

Went for à walk with a friend on Selby and decided to head towards the direction of the Cathedral. We were having some deep discussions on the nature of religion and the importance (or lack of) in modern day child rearing. We also discussed our childhood days and the impact Catholicism had on our lives and who we are today. As we passed the Rectory, we came to a stop but our discussion kept going until slowly we both were just taking in this magnificent structure. We stood in silence looking at the arches, the Heroic size marble statues of the four evangelists, the exterior walls (Rockville granite from Saint Cloud, MN) and, of course, the copper-clad dome (renovated in 2002!) and finally broke silence by having the most eloquent expression known to humanity "....wow...." This friend then commented the power of people coming together to build structures to something greater than the individual and creating a Landmark that will be here long after they are gone. This was humbling and empowering. I am proud to live only a few miles away from this magnificent Cathedral and also humbled at the free awe you can glean by just taking a moment to marvel at this beauty. I could use all my breath recommending to take this in but YOU should just go yourself. If you must capture the moment with your little magic rectangle, then do so, but I suggest closing your eyes, breathe deep and then open your eyes focusing on a specific part. Repeat this as many times as needed. You'll feel better, believe me. I sure believe
The cathedral is a beautiful and great place to go to mass. It is a spectacular work of art and I would recommend it to anyone. Christian or not. It is a beautiful tourist attraction as well.

name: Minnesota State Capitol
address: 75 Rev Dr Martin Luther King Jr Boulevard., St Paul, MN 55155, USA
reviews: Such a beautiful Capitol! This reminds me a lot of the Texas State Capitol, similar artwork and architecture. There really isn’t much to see inside of a Capitol but to be able to walk through and take in the beauty of a building is worth it. The marble stairs are absolutely gorgeous. If you are around the Minneapolis/St. Paul area, I highly recommend you check out the Capitol.
Paid parking $2/hr. Beautiful from outside and interior. The thing that I didn’t like that I cant go inside the senate/chambers/court rooms. They were locked and only can see behind the bars.
Beautiful and historical place to visit. Will definitely comeback for a guided tour next time I'm in MN.

The Minnesota State Capitol is the seat of government for the U.S. state of Minnesota, in its capital city of Saint Paul. It houses the Minnesota Senate, Minnesota House of Representatives, the office of the Attorney General and the office of the Governor. The building also includes a chamber for the Minnesota Supreme Court, although court activities usually take place in the neighboring Minnesota Judicial Center.

Took the guided tour here. Very well presented and the building itself with it's giant pillars is a great example of amazing contrition. Tour includes visiting the Minnesota Assembly and Senate (which was in session that day so we could not enter that chamber as it was full at the time). Also houses the Minnesota Supreme Court which was very impressive to see,. Court was not in session on the day of our visit. Also includes the main reception room. Tour is about 45 minutes and includes a lot of Minnesota History very well presented. Many steps to climb to enter the Capitol and grounds surrounding it are very nice.

name: Minnesota History Center
address: 345 W Kellogg Blvd, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: See my awesome review of the Gale Family Library if you want a much too detailed explanation of visiting the library! I didn't go to the museum but the building was nice. The cafe smelled good. Everyone was helpful and nice.

This is a decent museum with a current exhibit on Prince.  I would have appreciated a bit more focus on Minnesota as a world-class technology center in industries such as supercomputers, medical devices, etc.  The CDC 6600, designed by Seymour Cray at Control Data Corp., was introduced in 1964.  It was not only the fastest computer in the world at the time, but it included native floating-point operations, which made it a hard core science machine.  The first wearable external pacemaker was developed in Minnesota (becoming Medtronic) as was the world’s first furnace thermostat (becoming Honeywell).

Wonderful museum! Enjoyable for all ages. Unique exhibits. The Greatest Generation and the Tornado room are our family favorites. Plenty to see and do for kids and adults, better for elementary age kids than toddlers.

Regardless of your age, there's bound to be something of interest for you to learn and explore at the Minnesota History Center. You could easily spend an entire visit looking at the various exhibits. The exhibits are really interactive and involving so they leave an impression of what it was like for people that experienced these events. 

There's a high amount of care and attention to detail to essentially all aspects of the visit: the website clearly details what you need to know, the parking is straightforward, and there's even a free coat check (with lockers available for a quarter).

A must go to place on a cold or rainy day. The range of exhibits are diverse and really hands on and interactive. There wasn’t that many people there the day I went. Overall, we had a fun time exploring the history of Minnesota and trying some of the interactive simulations. This place is great for families or people wanting to learn something new

name: Science Museum of Minnesota
address: 120 W Kellogg Blvd, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: We had an amazing day as a family. We all had so much fun and were kept busy for 4 1/2 hours and we still could have seen more. The membership is a sweet deal and my husband and I don't know why we waited this long to get one. We will go back soon. By the way, the cafe was good and reasonably priced. I got the vegan salad (only vegan item on the menu) and was pleasantly surprised. It was fresh and loaded with nuts and all kinds of good stuff. The dressing was awesome. Fun, fun, fun day.

Went there back in 2008 and I was just astounded by everything they had. My first museum trip and I was pleased. Went to see the titanic exhibit and I was very very excited I am a huge titanic fan. I loved that my friends and I got to learn how the ship worked and we even got "boarding passes" for it just as if we were going on the real thing. It was really really really fun. Hoping I can bring my kid and husband there one day.

This is a great place for a date or to bring kids. Plenty to do and see. Only reason for 4 stars is the cost of the day. It was $20 for parking (although I guess there was a dog show so if you told the attendant you were just going to the museum it was $10) and tickets for me and my 4 year old was $34. On top of that we bought concessions so it was quite a pricey day. 

Overall it was a good experience and the staff was helpful.

Had an amazing time at the science museum with my kids. The museum is large and after almost 3 hours had to leave and still didn't do everything! 
Parking was fine but expensive. My only complaint is this museum has pretty steep admission prices as compared to similar attractions throughout the twin cities. But its so much fun you forget how much you paid once you get in!

We got there at 10am,  parking garage was nearly full. Fortunately we found a spot, unfortunately we drive a Tahoe and the parking spot was built for a Prius. The wrist bands are made from cardboard, rough on the wrist (especially the kids). I was also asked by a worker to not hold my toddler because they have “a two feet on the ground policy.” Exhibit were fun though! 

Overall, Don’t think we will be visiting again. There are many places to go with our kids where policy and facilities bring a positive experience.

name: James J. Hill House
address: 240 Summit Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Went on the 75 minute tour. Purchased tickets for $10 each in advance since some had sold out days before we were to visit. Only parking available is on the street, so we arrived early to get a spot. Beautiful mansion that you get to tour 4 of the 5 floors. Almost all furnishings are original and the mansion is very well maintained. Tour guide was very informative and answered questions. They are very particular about not touching things and leaning against walls and furnishings which is to be expected. You also get to see some behind the scenes areas which is rare in these older homes. We enjoyed the tour and may go back around Christmas when it is decorated.

I know it seems crazy to bring two young kids to an historic mansion but they loved it! They’ve asked to return each year and have an uncanny ability to ask just when I was thinking about it. 

The tour guides have an incredibly deep knowledge and I love the color commentary that they provide about the family and the era. 

I’m sure that my favorite space is the kitchen. The idea that Mrs. Hill worked to can jam is one that I can relate to.

A favorite destination for historical tours and also performances--they feature plays, musicals, and concerts through the MNHS in partnership with community performance companies and artists. All of the events and tours I've attended here have been a delight! 

Leave plenty of time to park and walk when you visit. And don't touch anything in the house (the docents will remind you quite directly if you forget). 😉

Truly an awe inspiring mansion. It's hard to believe that the man who had this mansion built started out with nothing and built one of the largest fortunes in the United States. He was a true visionary! And his taste was beyond compare.

We saw the play "Daddy Long Legs". It was staged in the main entrance at the foot of the grand staircase. The audience (about 40) sat in a circle. Was well done in this beautiful setting. We will  go back for the house tour soon.

name: Historic Fort Snelling
address: 200 Tower Ave, St Paul, MN 55111, USA
reviews: Fun place to take a walk in the woods with a camera. The deer are pretty human tolerant and allow you to get close enough to get some good photos.

Wow
Veterans are free. Worth the visit plus beautiful views of the river and creepy vibe
We went to the state park and hiked, we didn't go into the fort. Lovely paths and history all around. Great place to go to hike close by. ❤️

Love this fort and the history behind it.  The people there were very nice and helpful. It is different from many of the forts I have visited. I'd go back and explore more. Veterans are free. Worth the visit plus beautiful views of the river!

Nice way to spend an afternoon. We brought our 4 month old in a stroller and that worked just fine. There’s only a few places that the stroller couldn’t go but the staff offered to keep an eye on it for us. Thanks! I recommend watching the intro video in the visitor center before you head out to the site. Can’t wait for the remodel.

name: Landmark Center
address: 75 W 5th St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: I was able to wander around the empty Landmark Center for about 45 minutes on a Thursday afternoon.   It is a beautiful building with tons of detail inside.  There were friendly staff at the visitor table to point me in the right direction for my short visit. I would suggest to start at the basement and work your way around each floor and then move up.  There is something to see in every floor.

We were able to kind of wander the building during the Winter Carnival, very interesting! I have been in the building on many occasions but had never really looked around before. Many rooms are labeled with historical tidbits and the basement has a great historical display with lots of information about the building and some of its infamous visitors. Great space for a gathering or reception.

This place has the BEST gift shop if you're looking for unique (and affordable) gifts!  So I absolutely love the different events that the Landmark Center does, from plays to the Ghost Tour to the Christmas Market.  But I also love their little gift shop!  It's not open as many hours as the building, but I've gotten so many unique gifts there!  Definitely worth checking out!

Quite a bit of history since this was the biggest building in St. Paul at one time in its life. We enjoyed a wedding and reception here last night. Elegance at first a four piece string ensemble for the wedding ceremony and later candlelit tabletops for each table at the reception. Then a social hour on the second floor and then a contemporary band playing 70s and 80s dance music on the dance floor. Very nice

Absolutely stunning wedding venue. The location for nearby churches and hotels can’t be beat, and the staff make the experience of wedding planning less stressful. We worked with Hilari who went above and beyond to meet our special requests, designed an amazing layout to meet the needs of our reception, and was an absolute joy to work with. Love that we could bring in the licensed caterer of our choice to create exactly the menu we wanted. I also have to say the value for the price in the Twin Cities is unbeatable. We comfortably seated 270 guests with room for cocktails and the dance floor.

name: Rice Park
address: 109 W 4th St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Nice park... My kids always love this place to come. We plan to spend time another day time...
A wonderful free event to get out of the house in the winter and do something fun! This event has been around for 100 years and is fun for the whole family.
Fun to see. Parking sucks.. we almost didn't go because of that. Luckily I found a spot when someone pulled out.
It is very small for a park. To me, it is really a small open air plaza like area in the downtown. It is nestled around some old ( and new) historic landmarks.
Small park. No play equipment.  However, it is a nice place to sit and enjoy the sights.  They have several events held there all year.

name: Wabasha Street Caves
address: 215 Wabasha St S, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews: I was hoping for a bit more “exploring” type tour with narrow passageways and the “And now on the right you will see a vein of gold” or lead or whatever. Our group was too large. The guide was good and really knew his history, but for that many people he should have had a microphone. I did like the large size photos set out at various points that we could inspect, cuz we were way too far away to see them when the guide was showing the group.
Fun 45 minute tour.  Something different from the typical tourist venue.  Thursday night music and dancing

We had a great time at the wabasha caves 
It is a very unique place to visit and have fun we will definitely be coming back again soon and this time we will stay till close.
When one come here for the first time it is a special feeling  at least for me it was maybe a little on the creepy  side. Cool experience 
Thank you. 
J. L

Had a great time on their gangster tour bus driving around Saint Paul.  Very Educational and entertaining hadn't done that since I was in school.  Definitely something fun for the whole family But you should be old enough to appreciate it my son was 10 and he loved it
Super interesting history and the tour guides love to answer questions. Great spot for something a little different!

name: Mears Park
address: 221 5th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: Great free music in the summer. They book the best local bands and really fill the park! Fun environment for young and old. They had a local brewing company's beer truck on site priced reasonably. The restaurants across the street are delicious, though on a night with a good band you might wait awhile for a table. We sat on a patio at a great place across the street for the opening band then moseyed into the park for some really good local brews and amazing music. We had family come in from out of town a few months back and knew we had to bring them here! Everyone had a perfect night. The park itself is very nice, too, and has art events on top of the music.

Bands on Wednesday during three summer. Food trucks to tickle your tummy. Lots and lots of choices. Beer truck with lots of Craft ales to try. Music,sunshine,dancing,food and a very clean scenic park. Easy to get to by bus or train.

A very quaint and nice place. My dog and I walk through often and enjoy walking along the water. If you live on the St Thomas campus, I recommend taking a walk through here because it is just beautiful and a quieter part of campus. There are even benches if you want to study in a quiet place.

Very pretty. A realistic running stream and mini waterfall. Lots of beautiful anual and perennial flowers blooming (July 24). Each garden area has a sign with the name of the person who cares for that section. Lots of space to roam, lots of park benches. Great eateries across the street with beautiful outdoor eating spaces with more plants and trees, with a hip vibe. Lots of fun on a summer afternoon or evening!

Went here with my Brother and his family to see a couple bands. Got some food from one of the food trucks and a couple beers from the Beer Tent. Was a very enjoyable Thursday evening. Highly recommended.

name: Twin City Model Railroad Museum
address: 668 Transfer Rd Ste. 8, St Paul, MN 55114, USA
reviews:
Why is it that the world we live in every day is made so much more delightful in miniature? 
Is it the birds-eye view?
Do we like to play God?
Is it impressive to see the time and attention people pay to lovingly recreate a place, a time period, or a scene? 
All of the above, yes.
Great place for kids 2+ who can keep their hands to themselves (for the most part) but gobs of hands-on toys and buttons throughout the exhibits.
Fantastic!

We went to see the "Night Trains." Grandma, mom, dad and a 2-year-old. It was fun for all ages. There are so many details to look at and buttons for pushing. We spent about an hour here but easily could have been longer. There are train tables for the little ones to build their own tracks.

Amazing displays, very interactive for all ages and completely kid and toddler friendly! Their Lego display is outstanding, they have 6 train tables for little ones and 3 Thomas trains for kids to become the engineer and run themselves. We will be back!

If you're kid is into trains, this a great place to visit! They have model trains, with buttons to push to make them go. There are also a dozen play tables in the back - think Thomas and Brio - so the younger ones have fun too. It seems to be a gathering spot for local clubs - Legos train group and staff tending to the displays. Family bathroom in the museum, and regular bathrooms in the main building.

OH YES!!!!!!!!

I am a BIG TIME train fanatic! This place is totally worth the tuppence they charge for admission. Great place if you have a soft spot for trains and model trains!

They have displays of many different gauges and locations. My favorite was the huge layout in the center of the room. This is the first time I spent 4 hours in such a small "museum" type location. The detail and interactivity was great. The staff was also great! As much as I shy away from locations with kids, this is a good place to bring children to introduce them to model trains. I couldn't wipe the smile off my face while I was there.

One last cool thing was that they have model train cars, engines and accessories for sale. I had to stop myself from buying anything as my current lay out is in storage and I cannot add to it until its back up!

I recommend this place. Its in a sleepy, little non descript mall, but well worth the visit for train enthusiast young and old.

name: Hidden Falls Regional Park
address: 1313 Hidden Falls Dr, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: Great place to go hiking, fishing, bird watching or have a picnic. Great picnic grounds. Fantastic views of the Mississippi River.  Has a  free great boat launch with ample parking for you truck and boat trailer. Nice hiking trail thru heavily forested river bottom lands.

Place was awsome with tons of possibilites. You could do anything from walking to fishing and more. The place has a nice lite man made water fall in a nice quite secluded place which is nice when one wants to enjoy more of nature.
Great beautiful park. Free of charges. Lots of parking spaces. Walking & hiking paths right down on the Mississippi River. Picnic booths & elegant hidden views.

Beautiful spot. Good fishing to be honest but it's probably not a good idea to keep anything from the river unless it's a really good catch. I have been tempted by the idea of catfish nuggets, however.

Neither hidden, nor falling.
We found them.
Still good.

name: Alexander Ramsey House
address: 265 Exchange St S, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: It's a beautiful place to know part of the history of Minnesota....No pictures or videos...

The historic tour lasts a little under an hour and allows you to explore all over the whole house, all three levels. What is especially good is that there are different tour hosts in each room of the house so you get many perspectives from folks in period dress who are play-acting that they really live there. When you're in the kitchen, they serve a lovely tray of cookies baked in the wood-burning stove. Our 4 year old granddaughter was interested throughout, but really got excited at the very end when they took us to the playroom and we saw toys from the time. Insights into the lives of the occupants were shared that made it historically memorable. The guide read from letters that were written at Christmastime from the wife to her husband.

A few years ago, I enjoyed a beautiful visit to the Alexander Ramsey House. I picked up the Ramsey family Christmas cookie recipe book. Today I made the Gingerbread Cookies and the flavor was excellent! Don't forget to add the ginger spice as it was omitted in the ingredients. I used 1 tsp of ginger and I baked them on parchment paper. Baking will take longer, depending on the cookie size and shape so watch closely and enjoy. In the pictures you will see my Nantucket Lightship basket that I just finished making.
I went to a Victorian Seance here for Halloween and I think that was the most fun event I’ve ever been to!! Gorgeous manor with stunning furnishings and art- at midnight. 10/10 would recommend.

Victorian Christmas tour was full for weekend.  The start at the visitors center is decked with many seasonal items along with historical books.  No pics allowed in the house itself!  Guides in period dress relate the customs of the time and stories of the Ramsey family.   Nicely appointed with Christmas tree in the parlor, and cookies from the wood burning stove offered to visitors.  Well worth  $12 admission for one hour tour.

name: Minnesota Children's Museum
address: 10 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Super fun! We went with our 2 year old and 6 month old and there was plenty for both to see and do. Highly recommend bringing a change of dry clothes if you are going to spend any time at the water area in the Sprouts room (3 and under) - they have air dryers but they can only get so much drying done.
This is such a fun and amazing place.  I have presented magic shows here many times and his picture is from the big fun Halloween event they did a few years back.

What can I say but we severely miss the old museum.  We barely ever go now and will probably not renew membership.  The old museum is no comparison to the new one.  So much more to do in the old one.  This one is just ho-hum.  Flashy, but no substance.  Even the craft/create room is a let down.  How about bringing back all the bins of fun stuff to let the kids create???  Sigh...why do all the good things have to go away for the "new and improved"  but never better versions.  I guess at least the folks who apparently were never at the old museum seem to love the new one...lucky they have nothing to compare it to.

My husband and I went to the "Adult Night" at the museum, and it was one of the most fun experiences I've had in the Twin Cities, and I grew up here!  You get to play with the different experiences, and try new things, and play all the games.  The lines for the beer were a bit long, but honestly, we were playing so much that we didn't feel like we needed to go back for beer.  We just had some when we got home, and enjoyed our time at the museum instead!

Very nice place. We were just there today. Plenty of fun for kids of all ages. The air tubes and ping pong balls were the best. Nice restaurant-toy shop on site. Clean  restrooms, and convenient parking.

name: Mississippi National River and Recreation Area
address: 120 W Kellogg Blvd, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: This bridge is longer and busier than it look and theres not a lot of restroom nearby so make sure youre ready especially when you have to park so far away because parking space is always scarce. But all said and done, its a very nice place to chill and go for a stroll.
I really enjoy going here.  This area is one of the most beautiful places in Minneapolis.  It always makes me feel so happy to live here.  We have such a beautiful city!

How can you go wrong with the Mighty Mississippi! The "area" is easy to access and get to. The trail system, either walking, riding bikes, or driving through the park in a car. It's all beautiful. Do some Nordic skiing in the winter too. Sit by the river and enjoy and beautiful and powerful energy.
I love this area of Minneapolis so much history and new age all in one. Also very peaceful with the river
One of my favorite places in Minnesota to go! Expecially on July 4th!

name: Como Regional Park
address: 1199 Midway Pkwy, St Paul, MN 55118, USA
reviews: Beautiful park, lots of open space to relax in the shade. Excellent bike trails and walking paths. Very nice zoo ( free admission ) a small lake with a fishing pier and a dock. Canoe and kayak rentals as well as tandem bikes and buggies. Very nice surrounding neighborhood. Great place to take the kids or even a first date. One of the gems of the twin cities....

Love this park, but especially the Como Conservatory. Gorgeous experiences in many environs. The sights, smells, and sounds are another world. I like it best when the crowds are minimal, and I can experience the solitude I love. Bring drawing materials, sketching is just awesome! The carousel is my favorite...I am seventy and the ride is still such a delight!

My kids love this place. We plan our trips to the zoo after 1PM because there's a good chance that the animals are awake from their naps. Except the cats, those cats do whatever they want. (Dad joke) my favorite exhibit is that of the snow leopard. Such a fascinating animal.

I love the size of Como Park Zoo, it's not tiring to visit with small children but has a good variety of animals. The zoo is clean and easy to get around. The botanical center is lovely especially on cold winter days! And the bonsai collection is fascinating

Donation admission means you can visit free, but the recommended $3 adults/$2 children is low enough that I don't see how anyone could not find that value on a visit. Despite some repairs being needed, a wintertime visit (non-ideal), and some new construction set to resume in spring, it was a worthwhile stop with a toddler. Small enough to cover quickly, and thorough enough to see a variety without needing a stroller.

name: Minnesota Transportation Museum
address: 193 Pennsylvania Ave E, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews:
Several trains to go inside. A large car that is a dedicated sitting area with toys for kids. Cool model train displays. Loved the Christmas event with Christmas music. Half mile train ride nothing much but my kids loved it. Really a nice place to go with little kids as a family. My 2.5 year old loves trains. Workers are super enthusiastic and love what they do. Nice lower stim place to go. Not much for food but there are tables if you wanted to pack lunch. 

Maybe the price is slightly steep but without other funding sources I’m sure it is what needs to be charged. I value the museum and will pay for the experience here and there.
Good place to take a family. It is interesting and has fun activities for children. My grandson's loved the ride in the caboose.

Great price, lots to do and see for kids and adults of all ages.  My kids love playing with the train sets as well as exploring the trains INSIDE the building.  They also love riding the train (outside) as well.  I really enjoy watching the model train set as there is so much detail and items hidden throughout the track.

My family worked for the SOO LINE RAILROAD so this museum reminds me of my grandfather. Its really a neat place. You get to see all the old train cars and how they ran them. They also have a toy train set up for kids to see.
This museum holds an excellent selection of railroad memorabilia.  It's staffed by knowledgeable volunteers.  Be sure to request a tour of the restoration shop.

name: Indian Mounds Regional Park
address: 10 Mounds Blvd, St Paul, MN 55106, USA
reviews: Its always been a nice place if you need some alone time. Its quiet and doesn't have a lot of traffic. Its really beautiful in the summer its one of the best places in the city. I've been coming here since i was a kid and its one place that hasn't change very much. plus it has one of the best views of the city

This park has a lot to offer. Open fields, park benches, Pavilions, a playground, public restroom, even a wonderful scenic view of the city. The burial grounds can also be a great sight if your into it. One complaint I do have however is that there's an ugly tennis court with cracks everywhere, and grass growing all over the court. Compared to the rest of the park it just looks hideous. The city either needs to tear it down or renovate it. Aside from that you got yourself a nice park. This place seems ideal for family picnics, or short strolls.
Excellent spot to host events as well as just hangout with friends a d family. Great play ground for kids. Very clean and we'll take care of.
Such a beautiful place to walk and enjoy the nature and history inside of a major city. Hopefully they don't take away the trail like the proposed signs around!!
First off this park is enormous with alot of different sections but overall it's very interesting.

name: Como Town
address: 1301 Midway Pkwy, St Paul, MN 55103, USA
reviews: This place had friendly people and were inexpensive. Lots of animals and shows to see.

My three year old loves this place! An amusement park with many rides that little kids can enjoy. You can buy an all-day or all-season pass and let your little thrill seeker go on their favorites over and over. There is also a fun playground with splash pad inside so bring extra clothes or at least a towel. Some rides allow an adult to ride with their kid for free (Bees, bumper cars, tea cups ) My only complaint is the dark, dank restroom on site but at least it's there.

The bathrooms in the main entrance were completely flooded and smelled like urine. We waited in line for a long time for the tiger coaster and they were not astute enough to shut it down while assessing whether it needed repairs so we had multiple times of people waiting in line while they were fixing it. We also had an issue with rude staff giving us a hassle about our tickets. Yes, we bought them a year ago, but they explicitly said “no expiration,” so I’m not sure why they made a big deal out of that. We purchased tickets - what’s the difference as long as we payed to get in? After we got that sorted out, the rest of the park was pretty fun. It would be really great if they had places where younger kids in the 2-4 year age range could play while their older siblings go on rides. This would make it MUCH easier on parents. Also, more clean bathrooms. Did I mention clean bathrooms? Don’t let this post discourage you completely from going to Como Town - we did have a lot of fun there and it’s a nice addition to the zoo. I just want to make you aware of a few shortcomings that were a bit disappointing, especially since we drove almost three hours to get there.
Accommodative activities for all while you enjoy time out with family

Great for kids 8 and under, I would say. (Any older and the kids might get bored because there are very few "thrilling" rides). Toddlers/preschoolers will enjoy the many options available to them, including a splash pad and playground! I wish there were more rides, though. You can do everything in a short period of time.

name: Minnesota Museum of American Art
address: 350 Robert St N, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews:
This is 5 out of 5 Stars! It currently features an exhibit called, "A Choice Of Weapons Honor And Dignity." It features the amazing photography of Gordon Parks, who brilliantly documented America during the Jim Crow era and Jamel Shabazz who covered from the 1980's through today.  

It's in the old Pioneer Press building in St. Paul which is the same building where Gordon Parks once worked.  You can feel the love that both of these fine artists put into their work. This is a must see and admission is free!

The "M" has a beautiful new extended exhibit space in the historic Pioneer-Endicott building.  It is a perfect place to display all types of art. They also have a large creative space where artists are invited to create art with the public. I have been there several times and have always enjoyed the exhibits including the current exhibit.

While the show participants weren't necessarily Minnesotan at the show I saw, the theme was timely, sensitively produced, varied, well curated. I would have liked a local interest "story", if that was included, I missed it. Also, we Googled the museum and each phone came up with different results. The build out is immaculate, but there were stairs to nowhere, I wished the bridge upstairs was utilized in the show. I want to show art here. There was a room for children and young adults, too, where we sat and made zines. Nice. Minnesota Nice!

A little underwhelming in size, but the artwork they have is diverse and beautiful. It's fun that they have included some of the beautiful history of the building. Looking forward to going back when their next expansion is complete.
Free admissions and located in a historic building. Eclectic curation in a newly renovated space.

name: Landmark Plaza
address: 379 St Peter St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Beautiful place, we visited just a few hours ago and had fun taking pictures with our favorite gang. The park is in need of cleaning and some work, I guess after the hard winter we just had in Minnesota is normal. Please keep it clean and  in good shape. Highly recommended it, walk around downtown and discover the beautiful architecture.
Fun area to walk around and people watch!  Cute statues of the Peanuts gang throughout the park😊
For the love if 'Peanuts' Characters

A nice place to come and really remember the best Peanuts tv episodes and the newspaper cartoons. The drinking fountain is still active through atleast September maybe October. Right now they have rainbow things hanging in the memorial.
A small, beautifully whimsical homage to the illustrator of many childhoods.  The bronze statues stand, or sit, poised in their most famous situations, each placed with their closest friends.

name: Bell Museum
address: 2088 Larpenteur Ave W, St Paul, MN 55113, USA
reviews: The College students working here are extremely helpful and attentive. This museum is full of quick to read informative and interesting facts about the universe and Minnesota wildlife. The displays are top notch! Disappointed the Planetarium was closed today and we wanted to see a show.

Spent the last 15 minutes of open hours walking around some of the galleries and I was impressed. So many visual displays with concise descriptions. Lots of wildlife and flora on display. Entry fee is a fair price. I’m definitely coming back to spend a lot of time taking it all in, as well as planning to see the planetarium presentations. Even the outdoor space by the pond is beautiful.
Very kid friendly exhibits my 3 year old daughter wasn't frightened by any of them. Highly recommend you bring your children there's lots of hands on things for all the kiddos to take part in.

Gorgeous museum! I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the museum and at how much I learned. There are so many interactive exhibits for younger kids too. My 3-year-old loved the beaver puppet theater, the stork mating dance tutorial was hilarious and the huge Touch and Feel Lab on the first floor has a lot of things to do, we ran out of time! I recommend anyone visiting Minnesota to put this on their top 5 things to see! Yes, top 5!!

This is a very informative museum.  It is great for all ages.  Has a touch section where you can check out cool rocks and bones and live animals.  I do wish that part was better labeled.  They had all these rocks and skulls but we didn’t know what they were!! The current giant moon exhibit is also very cool and interesting to see.  The exhibits were immaculately clean I’m not sure how they do it, but probably the cleanest natural history museum I’ve ever been to.  I also enjoy that there seems to be room for growth of new exhibits as time goes one.

name: Phalen Regional Park
address: 1600 Phalen Dr, St Paul, MN 55106, USA
reviews: There is a new thing that was built with a China theme. And it is so amazing! All the people who worked on it were very skilled. If you haven't been to Lake Phalen for awhile its worth the trip. Its on the west side of the Lake
Great place to goes for a good long walk. Nature's scenery. Love it alot
Very nice sized park. One star less cause they could put more engaging spaces for children.

This place has come a long way. No motorized boat on the lake means peace and quite; the perfect 5k walk/run. The run around the lake offers uphills, downhills, and flat asphalt. It gets  crowded during the summer days. Early mornings, later evenings and weekdays before 3pm are the only time anyone can ride bike without interruptions of dodging walkers/runners. Surprisingly deep at 91 feet.
The place it beautiful! That and the beach is loads of fun! I love both running around the lake and swimming in it! They got a platform you can dive off of as well! Fun for you and the whole family!

name: Harriet Island Park
address: 200 Dr Justus Ohage Blvd, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews:
The Harriet Island Park is breathtaking. It was a lot nicer than I expected. It is especially beautiful in the fall! 
     There is free parking on the streets and some in parking lots. 
     This area can be sketchy at times so be careful especially by yourself.
      You can rent bikes which there is a bunch of  and sometimes you can find a scooter to rent.
       There is a wonderful part for kids to play in with all ages. There is even a zip line!

So beautiful with the city of St. Paul as a back drop. Handicap accessible with wide lanes to enjoy the views. Riverboats, free scooters, large grassy areas to picnic. I meet a new friend that was biking from Egan and back on this lovely day. Many nice people were out and about. Well maintained and groomed. A wedding was going on in a lovely small bldg. During my visit. So if you want a romantic place to spend with your SO or spend quality time with the family I suggest this place. Oh yes free bicycles too. I will be back.

Besides the homeless people and rude bike lady, it's a pretty place to walk around. Lots of wild flowers on the path. Tried to go down by the river, but the path lead to a small camp that looked like someone's home so we turned around. There was also a guy hiding in the bushes, which was slightly scary. But hey, the flowers are pretty.
It was flooded the day I visited but still a beautiful place. Plenty of parking and some nice walking trails.
Nice park with walking and bike trails. Also has picnic tables. Good for an evening walk or a family picnic. Amazing views of downtown St Paul.

name: Lilydale Regional Park
address: 950 Lilydale Rd, St Paul, MN 55118, USA
reviews: A very nice park! My school visits the park often and we treat it like our own backyard. Fairly clean and you can do lots of things within the park with how much space there is. The park looks really cool when it's flooded in the spring!

Lilydale Regional park is nice! I went there during a fest on my visit to the US from India called the “veg fest”. One of my friends had a stall during the fest where I ‘was helping l. The team of volunteers were super helpful. The place overall is nice and decent. Lively when people are around and silent and serene when there are just a few. Feels very nice and connected to the nature.. Good place to spend an evening with kids or friends.
So quiet and natural. Lots of wildlife including the homeless ;), but very very nice to be minutes from our house.

Beautiful open space! Truly defines what a park should be! Enjoy nice open space with lots of grass. Great place to take the kids (young & young-at-heart). Also a nice spot to get away from downtown without having to go to far!
And also nice for big outdoor events! Like the Red Bull Flugtag! (See pics)
Nice place to stop after work and relax. Beautiful park.

name: Large Green Chair
address: 480 Smith Ave S, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
This is a nice free attraction to take pictures at on a wonder Minnesota night! I would not recommend going to this attraction and climbing on it when it is wet. The chair is slick even when it's dry. 

It may be hard to climb for some because there isn't stairs or ladder to the top of it. You however don't need to be extremely good at climbing an average climber can make it up just fine.

There is parking on the street in the area around the park. There isn't a parking lot.
The Large Green Chair is a very fun place to take photos and spend some time in the beautiful outdoors!
Big green chair is a quick fun stop for tourist. There is limited parking near by.
Was an Excellent Day to go walk about!
My kids love climbing on this thing!

name: Crosby Farm Park
address: 2595 Crosby Farm Rd, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: Pristine park, wish it had maps of trails for new visitors, but our exploration lead us closer to the Mississippi river bank. The easier trail to go with the elderly to enjoy the vista. Spotted lot of stinging nettles on the floor level and lofty gigantic trees all living harmoniously!

Very cool place for a nature walk
I like to stop here before or after work sometimes

Great place to walk along the river. I take my son and we meet my friend and his daughters and usually do a 3 mile round trip walk. Beautiful place. Paved and non paved trails too. Dog friendly and bike friendly.
I really liked the trails. There are several downed trees that seem to have been there for some time now. It would be nice if those were removed.
Great get away within the city. Rare encounters with people

name: Crosby Farm Regional Park
address: 2595 Crosby Farm Rd, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: Great easy hiking and biking, easy access and a large area to spend a few minutes or hours of time. The City of St. Paul has done a remarkable job with wildlife presentations that one forgets that you are in the city. It has paths that lead to the University of Minnesota to the north and regional county regional parks just south of the city.
Great place for a peaceful walk!

Been going to this place my entire life and I am always. so happy to be here. It's a hidden gem that has sandy beaches by the river, to a peaceful dock, to a path along a cliff to a quiet walk in the forest. Best place to spend afternoons.
One of my most favorite places to go hiking.

Went to Crosby Farm Regional Park a week ago and had a wonderful time.  Though most of the trails were closed due to flooding, we made the best out of the situation.  The wetland boardwalk was flooded with about a foot of water, but still walk-able with caution.  The sun was shining and the water was clear so we took off our shoes and waded through the watery trail.  It was like a mini tropical location but in MN :)

name: Cafesjian's Carousel
address: 1245 Midway Pkwy, St Paul, MN 55103, USA
reviews: So much fun with children. A chance to experience a classic carousel that has so much more to offer than any other in the metro
A very nice, little (and inexpensive) stop to add a Come memory.
A beautiful and fun carousel with very friendly staff and interesting historic information
This price is right and the carousel is beautiful.  Our kids love it every time we come and at $2/person it's affordable for the whole family.

Over 100 years old, caught fire in 1939, it has been restored and continues to run to this day.  I rode it as a child at the Minnesota State Fair. I brought my children to ride and now my grandchildren. They love the ride as much as I do. I know that we will continue to visit the carousel for years to come. You never outgrow the fun of the carousel.

name: Fort Snelling State Park
address: 101 Snelling Lake Rd, St Paul, MN 55111, USA
reviews:
I've lived in MN my whole life but never knew this state park was hiding in the twin cities! I've been to historic fort snelling before and wrongfully assumed that was the same thing as the state park! 
The park is lovely and has many amenities; several pavilions, bathroom buildings, a playground, the beach access to the Minnesota River! It's just a great way to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful, well maintained park. The views are fantastic, hiking off trail is fun - and it's tough to get lost when you know you're always between the river and the bluffs! I love going here with my friend and her dogs.

Broad expanse of wilderness located close to Minneapolis and Saint Paul. The river valley is a beautiful and varied landscape with lots of running water, small lakes, and ample wildlife. I went here last for a candle lit new year's walk that was gorgeous. Keep putting on great events like this and I will keep coming back.

Excellent spot for super moon rising views. Historical, interesting. The lower part is a lovely river bottom park with a network of trails, plenty of parking, picnic areas and a spring fed lake for swimming.
HUGE state park right off the freeway. It gets better the further in you go. Pike island is a highlight. Many deer and turkey all over the park. You can walk to the fort from the park.

name: Battle Creek Regional Park
address: 2300 Upper Afton Rd, Maplewood, MN 55119, USA
reviews: Huge stretch of trails through woods, different paths to go down every time you visit keeps it new and exciting. There are a few open spots along the trails which are great for the dogs to play together. My dog absolutely loves coming here (and sitting on the benches)

Looks like it could be a nice hiking spot. But all the trails are apparently reserved for cross county skiing right now. Having that posted somewhere online before getting to the park would be great. Google also couldn't figure out how to navigate us to the parking lot of the park without explicitly saying we wanted the community center.

Battle Creek Regional Park is a sprawling park with bike and hiking trails, forests, winding creeks, and a variety of activities for all to enjoy.

This is one of my favorite parks in the area, as there are just so many things to do.

Definitely worth a visit!

The park is awesome. The trails are awesome.in the winter time it would be nice when they plowed to go over it again when the snow melts a little bit so there's no ruts.I only say this because I use a walker when I do my walk. Spring summer and fall is great.Battle Creek Park is great and you guys are doing a fantastic job.

This is the most amazing dog park! It's so big you can take a nature walk though it. I love bringing my dogs here. We all get to exercise and have fun exploring. Make sure you bring water for you pups though, they don't have water fountains, and you and your pups will need water after all that walking. 😁

name: Bruce Vento Nature Sanctuary
address: 4th St E, St Paul, MN 55106, USA
reviews: A small park being renovated little by little from toxic dumping and industrial space to prairie. A sacred site to indigenous people, and some great collaborations are happening here. There’s a small parking lot so it’s easy to visit. Good interpretive signs to learn about the history of the space. Wave at the prairie when you visit.
Great place to escape the city that's literally right across the river from downtown St. Paul. Some nice walking trails, wildflowers and bird watching when you can't take a longer trip out of town.

A nice place to go! If you want to get out of the city (Downtown Saint Paul/LowerTown area) you can! 
15-20 min bike ride and your in the wilderness/forest. If you time it right you might even see a couple deer!

Decent park for a walk in downtown. Trails are ok. Beautiful clear waters make for easy viewing of local wildlife. Homeless folks are about as well. Doesn't feel safe, but it is convenient to access. Nice dog walking.
Follow this trail all the way up to Maplewood it is a nice grade fully dedicated path that never gets too crowded.

name: Frederick R. Weisman Art Museum
address: 333 E River Pkwy, Minneapolis, MN 55455, USA
reviews: Really great experience. Relatively smaller than many traditional art museums but the collections are really impressive and highlights local as well as national artists. The building itself has a modernist architecture. Worth a visit while in Minneapolis.
This has always been a fun place to go. Very intimate. Great gift shop for unique gifts.
Impressive building design and beautiful art collections. Whenever visiting Minnesota University, you could walk to this place via connecting bridge easily.
Fantastic museum, in the heart of the Minnesota campus. We really enjoyed our time there.
Great place to take in some culture.  Open to the public, lots to look at.  Staff is great.  Be sure to support your local artists.

name: St Louis Church
address: 506 Cedar St, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: This may be called the little church but there's nothing little about it's beauty.  A reverent place that shares its grandeur through stained glass, beautiful designed heavenly sounding organ, and an overall sense of God's presence.  A wonderful place to worship.
This church is so beautiful inside and is a very peaceful place to come and reflect. The architecture is amazing!
Another great concert. Widor raises the rafters

A small, quaint, ornate Catholic church in downtown St. Paul.  One of the speediest masses I've ever attended at 40 minutes.  I dont know if it was just that particular day or not.  A very beautiful church.
Beautiful church with windows tracing French Catholic saints and history in North America

name: Church of the Assumption
address: 51 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Lovely Catholic Church ... Confessions every day.  Mass every day.  Downtown Church. Nice parking lot. Tuesdays Our Lady of Perpetual Help Devotion and Fridays, Devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus.
I was here for a wedding. The inside is really beautiful and was a lovely setting.

My mom’s visitation, funeral mass, and luncheon were here and the church is absolutely beautiful and the people who worked with me were extremely sensitive and helpful. I was completely lost as far as planning a funeral and they helped me with everything and made it much easier for me. 

I always assumed parking would be difficult considering the location on 7th Street, but there is a huge parking lot in back, so it’s very easy to visit the church.
My husband and I love our church,  we are the 5th generation to worship in this beautiful church
Pretty church. Nice service.

name: Padelford Riverboats
address: 205 Dr Justus Ohage Blvd, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews: This was one of the best experiences I’ve had in the area. With good weather, and great people, this trip can be very memorable in every way. Great opportunity to have some drinks and be a part of some great conversations. The tour guides tell some great stories, and explain some of the things the boat will pass. Kids would love this so much since you’ll see some animals on the shores or eagles for them to see. They can learn a little bit about the history, and you can relax as they can’t go too far since you’re on a boat. I highly recommend doing this at least once! Make sure the weather is good. Although for us it was a little hot, the breeze outside felt great, and when it got too hot we came inside and the AC felt great. The outside area though was a bit crowded. Such a great time overall! 8 out of 10 for sure.

Fabulous time on the riverboat cruise.  Our boat was great with a covered open upper deck.  Lower deck was enclosed and air conditioned.  Had a couple of tasty margaritas and a great history lesson narrated by Don Shelby.  Great time.
Me & my family went on this boat on Aug. 6th. It was so nice  & relaxing. Learn great information.

Loved the cruise today! It was perfect weather and a lot of fun. The narration is really interesting. Fun to learn about different sites in the Mississippi River. Great for any Minnesotan or traveler!

Not sure why this came up under my husband's name?  I'm the one who bought season tickets and have gone on the boat many, many times.  Anyway, I LOVE IT!!  It's relaxing, the staff is awesome, and it's a great way to spend a few hours.  My friend bought season tickets for 2018 and we went several times...loving it....so myself and another friend bought season passes for this year, 2019.  The season pass includes 3 extra passes so we've been able to invite others along and we've had great fun!!  We've met a variety of interesting and nice people on the boat.  Along with your purchase of a season pass, you get two passes for one specialty cruise..such a great deal.!!!  I hope to do the season passes for 2020 as well..!!!  THANK YOU Padelford Riverboats!!  I am one happy customer!

name: Stone Arch Bridge
address: 100 Portland Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55401, USA
reviews: If there's one place in Minneapolis, I absolutely love it's the Stone Arch Bridge. Always a delight, always amazing. The views from here are marvelous and you will always find people, walking, running, with their pets, biking, skateboarding, roller skating etc. here. If you're having a bad day or month or year, just go and walk the Stone Arch bridge, let the winds and sounds of running water loft up your spirits and let you find joy and peace. Do visit here surely, if you're coming to Minneapolis, would be my 2 cents for life. Enjoy and post more pics. :)

An iconic spot to visit that gives a nice view of downtown skyline, the mill ruins and the mighty Mississippi. The North side of the river has some great places to eat and a theater to catch a movie. Great place for an evening stroll.

Love walking on the Stone Arch Bridge! Offers a panoramic view of St Anthony Falls. The bridge links to Father Hennepin Bluff Park and Mill Ruins Park. There is a center you are able to visit. The center is called the Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock & Dam Visitor Center. The center is located at the west end of the bridge. In the Fall there is a car show and craft show combined. Please go to their website. Many events happen during the Summer and Fall.

Historic, historic, historic!  Take a lovely stroll along this gently curving wonder and feel the past come alive!  The mute beauty of this engineering marvel is as relevant today as it was when it was created!   This special area pulls together decades of Minneapolis history!

One of best place in minneapolis. People come here for outing with famiy n friends, walking, jogging. It gives view of old buildings like Gold Medal Mill, Pillsbury mill, Mill museum and the buildings on modern era in downtown. Enjoyed the walk on Sat Feb 22, 2020 when it was a sunny day with temp 43*F

name: Thompson County Park
address: 360 Butler Ave E, West St Paul, MN 55118, USA
reviews: Lovely trails in the winter. I can't wait to come back in summer!

Wide forest paths. Rolling hills with lush grass. The visitors center is conveniently placed with many amenities. Tons of benches for resting and enjoying the lake view. Plenty of bathrooms and parking spots as well!

I have hopes since the decision was made to clean out the lake. When I was a kid I'd go fishing here for fun. Then for a while all you could get was bullheads, and now it's not a good fishing spot at all, so all the dock is good for is sight seeing, maybe spotting a few ducks. Otherwise no. I'm hoping someone decides to help restore the ecosystem of the park

Small but very cozy park. Great for relaxing walking,  and not relaxing running :). Often I see people fishing there. 
Also you can rent building for wedding.

Lovely trail around Thompson Lake with native trees and plants. Fall colors just starting. Nice meeting facility at Dakota Lodge. Construction closed off south end of lake, no signage. Crew said it was a restoration, but when we questioned the heavy equipment and tree removal,  worker said a sewer leak had caused contamination.

name: Northwest Airlines History Center
address: Crowne Plaza Aire MSP Hotel, 3 Appletree Square, Bloomington, MN 55425, USA
reviews: I’ve been staying for 5 days at the Crown Plaza Suites MSP Airport and it was not until the last day that I came across the NW Airlines museum on the 3rd floor. What a great experience which I had more time! Wish the hotel lobby had more signage. Please visit the attendants are very pleasant and very knowledgeable.

Must see for any former Northwest employees, their families, or those who are interested in aviation and/or Northwest Airlines.  A modest collection but extremely interesting. Smaller children would likely not find anything interesting. Plan on spending up to one hour looking at the various collections.

What a fantastic collection of artifacts from NWA.   Most of them items that would have otherwise been trashed or forgotten about.   The volunteers the day I went were former employees and recounted many stories.  I could have stayed another hour talking to them.  Definitely recommend a visit if you're looking to kill some time before a flight.    Just note the signage isn't that good for finding it.   Best way in is to park in the hotel parking lot top level then enter through the glass doors then up the stairs one level which can be found beyond the pool

This place is a bit hidden but is a neat visit.  Exhibits on the history of Northwest and the airlines that merged into it.  Staffed by retired NWA employees.  The collection is impressive, much of it donated by the airline itself or by Delta when they bought it.  Some exhibits rotate periodically. Was very impressed.  Very close to MSP so doable during a long layover as well.
Very informative and fun .Hotel needs to increase awarness of location of the museum.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald Birthplace
address: 481 Laurel Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Came after hearing about the "poultrygeist" chicken.  Sauce did not mess around but neither did my girlfriend and I, we tag teamed the sandwich and it was amazing.  Great flavor and not too hot while you eat but be sure to have some beer or dessert at your table because it will burn for a while (and the next day no doubt). Will definitely be back.
Little historical stop.
Enjoy historical sites.
Great pilgrimage for an F. Scott fan!
Where it all began.... Right in a city block.

name: Gibbs Farm
address: 2097 Larpenteur Ave W, St Paul, MN 55113, USA
reviews: We enjoy this place very much. It is a good place to spend a couple hours learning a bit about the history of native people and pioneers in this area. We also enjoy the summer day-camps here.

An interesting historic oasis in the middle of the city. This 1850s farmstead is well- preserved, and tells the story of early settlers of this area, as well as their native American neighbors. Absolutely worth the visit.

To tour guides are fantastic and very knowledgeable in the history of the farm and family that lived there. A lot of different things going on, such as metal foraging, ice cream social and a couple different tours. Really enjoyed our morning and learned a lot as well.
Love the story of it history and  ice cream to

I would give this place 0 stars if it let me.I found a post saying that they had a holloween party on the 29th from 10 to 4. I showed up with my two toddlers and was told that I was mistaken. After I showed the woman the post she said, very rudely, I had to leave. I wouldn't have rated this place if I was shown a little respect and they took a little responsibility and apologized for there mistake. I will never recomend or go there again. Staff was rude.

name: Mill City Museum
address: 704 S 2nd St, Minneapolis, MN 55401, USA
reviews: Visited with wife and 17 yr old daughter. We all thought it was great. It was STEM day so perhaps there was a bit more going on than normal, but for $30 total, it was well worth the 2.5 hours. Minneapolis movie is well done. Flour tower is extremely well done and observation deck is great (exterior closed in winter). We all felt it was well worth our time. Highly recommended.

A great historical and interactive museum for all ages. My 5 and 3 year old love going. The elevator tour is really cool. And the view from the top is great. Good for short visits 1 1/2 hours - to longer 3 - 4 hour visits. Free entry with history museum membership.

Really cool museum! The views are crazy cool from the observation deck and there is some great history about the cities and how things came to be! If you like museums and have a spare hour I recommend checking it out, and then walking next door to the Guthrie for a fantastic show.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this place! I had heard good things from my daughter who attended a field trip here, but found it to be even more interesting than she described it. The staff were all very knowledgeable and engaging. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who hasn't been.

This place is so cool, I used to come here as a kid all the time for school field trips. I’ve since come here in recent years and it’s all still so fascinating to see how a different era of Minneapolis worked. To see a what this thriving industry was once like. If you’re looking for a cool day trip, this is worth it.

name: Mill Ruins Park
address: 102 Portland Ave S, Minneapolis, MN 55401, USA
reviews: Interesting and unique. It's not large at all (very much a small downtown park.) Basically, it is much like the other riverside parks along the pedestrian trail that follows the river, except for the mill. Still, because of the mill, it's very scenic - a neat spot to stop by if you're in the area.

A nice place along the river banks. Many things to do in the area and bridge crossings to connect you to the north side of the river for even more options of activities and dining. Plus some great views of the city and the old ruins that make a large part of the cities history.

Love Mill Ruins Park! Combines the history of Minneapolis with present day. Mill Ruins Park is part of the Central Mississippi Riverfront Regional Park. Living in Minneapolis is the best. So much to see and do.

History is great, but the train and tracks inside the building are cool. Has a nice cafe that's kind of hidden, and nice little gift shop with Minnesota/Minneapolis local types of interesting finds. Also near the farmers market!

There is a protected bike lane covering the entire loop. Seeing the history of the flour milling industry and how it shaped the city of Minneapolis and the Mississippi River is pretty cool. The signage for pillsbury and gold medal flour is maintained and lights up at night. If this is your first trip to the twin cities I'd recommend the loop in warmer weather or bundle up. The paths are well maintained and there are informational plaques the entire way.

name: Mattocks Park
address: 441 S Macalester St, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: Seems busy today but a local guy  said it was quiet, guess this is a very popular park

This neighborhood park is a lot of fun. The equipment isn't anything special, but has the basics to help kids busy. I do wish there was a restroom. (During tennis season, there is a port-a-potty available. ) There are communal play toys available, such as sand toys and push toys.

Cute park that is great for smaller toddlers. Lots of small children for my son to play with. In a good area with lots of toy trucks in the sand pit. Only thing I didn't like were people allowing their dogs to be off leashes but they didn't bother us.
I love this park, it’s nice and protected from the sun and there’s a bunch of sand toys there for communal use. Huge thank you to whoever contributed them!!

This park has it all, several grilling areas and picnic spots for families. Also plenty of open grass, so bring a blanket or two to sit down on.  There's also a rather large kid friendly park with the rubber floor so falls don't hurt, plenty of good activities for kids on the park and lots of seating spots to supervise at. Theres also a 3ft wading pool, beware that there is no life guard on duty, but this is a great place to bring the little ones on a hot summer day. There are also fields and courts for sports here. Anything you could want at a park can be found here

name: U.S. Bank Stadium
address: 401 Chicago Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55415, USA
reviews: The family went to Monster Jam and watched monster trucks tear up the stadium and entertain the audience with their trick driving.  It was very fun for the whole family.  The facilities such as food services, alcohol, refreshments, and restrooms were clean and refreshing.  The lines were long and I opted out of some services over others, but that comes with the crowds.  The stadium offered sound dampening apparel, which I found very important for the experience.  The security check to enter the facility was quick and stress free.  I felt very safe during my experience.

Took my 2 yr old son here for the packers game on Dec 23rd. It was awesome and he only lasted til halftime which was fine. The private suites we were up in seemed to start off with a bang on the food layout then gradually got worse through the rest of the game. Not everyone is drinking and cant taste good food. I expect better if Im paying for prime tickets, not something I would get if I walked to a food stand out of reg seats.

My first time to U.S. Bank Stadium was for Monster Jam. We were 2 rows from the ceiling! The sound was good, the view was good even though it was far away. The facilities are very clean. Getting around was easy. Even though we were at the top, there were escalators to help make the trip bearable. There were plenty of vendors there, but even more that weren't open. I imagine they're for sporting events. The size of this place is amazing!
Super noisy. Can't expect anything other than noise. But the Twins have a great open air stadium. Very family oriented, in my opinion. Easily accessible by Metro Transit.

Amazing stadium and if you’re lucky enough to get a suite the offering of food and drink is great. The concourses are wide and there is t a bad view In the house. Plenty of bathrooms. Only thing that could be better would be more parking options nearer to the stadium.

name: SEA LIFE Centre Minnesota
address: Mall of America, 120 East Broadway East Side, Level, One, Bloomington, MN 55425, USA
reviews: This is an enjoyable experience with a good variety of species to see. The underwater tunnel is a great walk through and you could spend a lot of time there. I'd suggest finding out when they're least likely to be busy, as it's better with uncrowded walkways and without a lot of kids making noise. Would be nice to have a full touch tank experience with some fish or rays and adding an octopus exhibit would be an improvement.

A decent Aquarium, I have enjoyed the place. There are many different varieties of fish and other sea species considering the size of the place you will find a wide range of sea life.If you compare it to Shedd or GA aquarium it sure seems pretty small but considering the space its in I thought it was good. We spent around 3hrs and it was fun. On a winter day this would be a perfect spot to spend a few hours with family. Kids will sure enjoy the place. There are a couple of spots where you can touch the fish which is cool and kids would enjoy it. The price isn't that bad either.

I'm just here in Minneapolis for work and I went to the Mall of America out of curiosity. It's a really well done aquarium. You walk down a hallway with amphibians and reptiles with scheduled guides. This leads to a 300 ft long tunnel with surgeons, shark, guitar sawtooth rays. This is the highlight although the jellyfish exhibit is a close second. The end has the shallow pools with sting rays and crustaceans you can feed. Definitely worth it for the tunnel

Interesting place, especially if you add the behind the scenes tour.  Though it's a small aquarium,  they do a great job of maximizing the various environments. In addition to the aquarium,  there are rain forest, jellyfish, coral, and stingray exhibits. 

The best deal is a membership if you're local and plan to go more than once a year. I was visiting from out of town and decided to go just to for  something different to do.

This place needs more organized lines and/or better trained staff. We purchased the wristband package with Sea Life included. When we went down to the sea life level, there was a long line to buy tickets and another line to get in. A woman was directing everyone to the ticket line.

We informed her that we already had the wristband package and she said we still had to wait in the first line. Fast forward 30-45 min later and an employee told people ahead of us that if they already had tickets they can proceed to the other long line to get in. I double checked with her about our wristbands and she said we also could have skipped this first line. If I hadn't checked with her it could have easily been another 30 minutes. The staff is friendly, and I understand this is a busy place, but it was a frustrating experience.

As for the experience itself, it also seems like one big line. You walk single file through most of the exhibit which is lack luster for the most part. The aquarium tunnels toward the end are pretty cool, but that's about it. This place kills a pretty good portion of your day, so unless you really enjoy fish, I would say skip it.

name: Swede Hollow Park
address: 665 Greenbrier St, St Paul, MN 55106, USA
reviews: A ton of stairs of you enter from the parking lot with picnic tables. Walking/biking paths. Woodsy paths too. More suitable for adults. There are bike paths that lead all over St Paul. Nifty thoroughfare in that regard.  Not busy.

Other than there no police presence here,EVER..And,terrible lighting on paths..which attract homeless & drugs..I LOVE this bit of nature right in the middle of the city!! And the " Friends of Swede Hollow Park " community group does all it can to keep it clean..and safer..(photo is of monument marker stolen, just weeks after it was privately replaced..police do nothing to stop these things😭)

I love the path, the swedehenge, the history. I love the stairs for a little workout. I love it through spring, summer and fall. I love the little path where the mansion was long ago. I also love the old brewery and what Flat Earth has done with their section of it. I love it all over. The homeless people that live there seem nice, too... I just wish they would be smarter with their fires so the fire dept doesn't have to waste time and money putting out trees.
Fun place to explore. Especially to ride scooters at. Long trails black top n dirt trails

Went for a walk during a warm winter day, the park is nice for a quick walk. I did see that there was broken glass everywhere and trash riddled the park, but I'm hopeful some of it is picked up by the city.

name: Guthrie Theater
address: 818 S 2nd St, Minneapolis, MN 55415, USA
reviews: Went here to see William Shakespeare's play. The staff there was so kind and was very helpful. The play overall, was very entertaining even for my nieces, which known nothing about the details of the play. They loved it. The view from the theater to St. Anthony bridge was lovely. It was a very beautiful place. Definitely going here again.

So lucky to have a theater of this caliber in town. Never been disappointed. Beautiful venue and not a bad seat in the house for the Wurtele stage. Young people, check out the 30 below program- going to be sad to turn 30 this year!!

Have attended multiple shows here, it’s different than rest of the downtown theaters for sure. Nice arrangement, every seat has a good view and good sound. The selected plays are always worth a watch. Easy parking in front of building and special pricing for rush club members.

They also have a awesome lookout balcony which has almost 360• view of stone arch area. A must watch during summer and fall.

We went and saw A Christmas Story last night. It was so amazing. The theater was beautiful. Not a bad seat in the house. We also ate and got drinks before in their cafe. Great food and service. I would highly recommend!

The Guthrie is a first class act! It's a whole lot of excellence throughout, from the amazing show to beautiful facility. I especially appreciate that the venue keeps their endless bridge and top floor lookout room open to the public. It's a great part of the neighborhood!

name: Minneapolis Institute of Art
address: 2400 3rd Ave S, Minneapolis, MN 55404, USA
reviews: Upon walking into the sleek, modern museum you can see a beautiful little garden through the glass. The building is expansive and very well designed. Every exhibit is placed specifically and maps are given when you walk in. With both coat check, maps, and helpful workers you can find any exhibit you want. You can also just browse and spend hours experiencing world class art. My favorite floor is the top one, where a painting hangs that is absolutely massive. It is modern and features two young men. Not sure if it is still there, as the museum keeps exhibits fresh and exciting. Spend some time at the cafe and sip on some coffee. There are more activities and rooms than just the museum itself. It is a wonderful way to spend the morning, afternoon, or evening.

This place deserves some hype. I've been there countless times on school field trips, or weekend outings with friends and family. I love the atmosphere as it doesn't feel stuffy or plain. It is full of life and really immerses you in different cultures. There are some exhibits I remember seeing over and over again, but each time I return I encounter something new. It is always clean and well organized, and I've never seen it be uncomfortably busy, even on the weekends. The rotating exclusive exhibits are always beautiful and informative, but even if you stick to just the free areas there is plenty to see. Free admission is truly a blessing, so donate if you can! This is a fantastic art museum.

We attended a dinner here on a Saturday night. It was a really fun atmosphere. Food was good. We did a scavenger hunt in the galleries looking for close up sections found in different pictures or exhibits. It was a good mixer and helped us look at the artwork again in new ways. Some things could only be seen up close while it took a far away perspective in order to "see" others.

It's an amazing Museum! I love that they display contemporary and historical art. They also have a Family Day once a month that provides a lot of great activities for kids! And, you can never go wrong seeing a show there at the Children's Theatre Company!

This is one of those cultural gems of Minneapolis you may not have heard of, but that you MUST go experience. I can’t believe this place does not charge admission! The art is world-class (I saw Picasso’s and Monet’s!) and there will always be something intriguing for you to see. The space is gorgeous and the docents are incredibly helpful. Go check this place out now!

name: American Swedish Institute
address: 2600 Park Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55407, USA
reviews: As a fine art photographer - the Swedish House Institute is an absolute favorite venue for me to shoot weddings at!  It is truly a space where I know I will be able to create jaw dropping photos....intricate details, a plethora of natural light, gardens that are just stunning, and a diversity of locations throughout the property make it perfect for weddings! On top of the beauty of the venue itself...the team at the Swedish House is also absolutely delightful to work with!
