Had a great time here! The mansion is beautiful and was worth the visit alone. Lots of areas to walk - went on Sunday at 4pm, pretty much had the place to ourselves to roam around. Friendly staff, especially the nice man who showed us around and told us a bit about the history of the place. Had a great time!

This was a fantastic experience that I recommend for all! The craftsmanship of this home is breathtaking and it was a fantastic experience all around. I also recommend going around lunch and getting their meatballs (they were amazing). Its a good 2-3 hour endeavor so make sure to space a little time.

I have loved this place for so many years. The house is beautiful especially at Christmas. The food is incredible. You can find really unique gifts at the gift store. And they also do a really good job with weddings. Recently attended a friends wedding here and the venue was beyond beautiful and staff were super friendly and helpful.

This place is always  a fun visit. It's an indoor tour of a magnificent  home. The architecture  is old world hand carved work. They offer food, exhibits, and a gift shop. Be sure to check the website to see what events they have coming up!

name: Minneapolis Sculpture Garden
address: 725 Vineland Pl, Minneapolis, MN 55403, USA
reviews: I've been living in Uptown for most of my life and can't tell you how many times I've visited this place. I absolutely love it. They have a wonderful mix of the old, historic sculpture alongside new installations. The gardens are nice to walk in. It's a great quiet place to read, study, or just go for a walk. The events they hold are fun and usually free. The greenhouse conservatory is nice too and I never got sick of that giant fish statue at the end ;)

Really interesting sculptures and a great place to take pictures. Some of the sculptures had information, but not all of them. This park could be improved with some additional lighting once the sun goes down. Still a fun visit!

This is the first time I've been to the sculpture garden and I have to say it's a beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy local art. There are many pieces to see and interpret for yourself. Great place to walk your dog or just spend a lesiurely afternoon!

Incredible display of art and architecture. Not only does it have large iconic installations but also smaller ones that are beautiful. Great in summer or winter, as you can pop into three sisters to warm up if you need to.

Very nice and free sculpture garden in the midst of the city. 

A relaxing and fun area to escape the hussle and bustle around you, smack dab in the downtown area, but turns quickly into a nice escape from the "city life", where one can enjoy peace and tranquility. 

Lots of nice art pieces to see, and full of friendly tourist and locals. 

I walked clear across the city to visit and was well worth the walk, specifically the crown jewel, the famous Cherry on a Spoon. 

Must stop if visiting Minneapolis.

name: Walker Art Center
address: 725 Vineland Pl, Minneapolis, MN 55403, USA
reviews: The Walker always has great exhibits and shows. The outdoor sculpture garden is great for bringing visitors to, or even active children who want to run around outside. Recently saw a great foreign film in their theater that was amazing! (Parasite)

My family and I have loved coming here. The exhibits are always interesting and the rotation of installments on the top floor have been intriguing and unique. The mini golf course is worth a play, but it is insanely challenging at times because it is more art than golf. The sculpture garden is a great oasis in the center of the city.

Great place. Fun to walk around. NUMBER ONE recommendation for newcomers is to KEEP AN OPEN MIND - Read the descriptions and try to think from the artist's perspective. Don't treat art at face value!

Gift shop is pricey but you can get some cool ideas there for art enthusiasts.

I love art, particularly paintings and photography. The Walker Art Center isn't my favorite type of art, being contemporary, but if that's what you like this is a fantastic place. The sculpture garden is quite nice, too.

My most permitted title for this place is "The Deviant Art Interpretive Center".

Although they do have some Real art and historic items of a value that are worth consideration and taking the time to study, this place has taken the most unfortunate turn toward making socio-political statements about where urban postmodernism has gone.

When given the chance, I prefer to sit in the car and read a good book or simply take a nap.

name: Kellogg Mall Park
address: 62 W Kellogg Blvd, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: I was there for the Saint Paul Winter Carnival to view the ice sculptures. It was a wonderful place to be frozen. The sculptures were beautiful. The view from the park was nice. The stage hosted good musicians. The concessions were yummy and warm

We came for the ice sculptures and festivities as part of the Winter Carnival. I understand it is usually at Rice Park, but due to construction,  it was here this year.  Nice view of the river and plenty of parking nearby.
Comfortable place you can sit to enjoy views and Mississippi River.
It was late when I got here after the MN Wild game, but I felt safe. There were 2 officers chatting in the park.  We came to see the ice sculptures.
It was beautiful foggy afternoon. Very nice few of St. Paul downtown.

name: Lake Nokomis Park
address: 4955 W Lake Nokomis Pkwy, Minneapolis, MN 55417, USA
reviews: This gem would be even better if climate change doesn't make the water sick. Stop putting chemicals on your lawns! Be responsible.

It's usually flooded but it doesn't stop me from running around it. I guess what most people like about it, is that it gives off a sense of serenity and tranquility. I like the willow trees that surround it. Occasionally the serenity and peace is ruined by the sound of large airplanes going overhead back to the airport. When it's not flooded, it's much easier to navigate.

nicely laid out, lots of parking and clearly marked signage everywhere. There's a separate bike path than foot path, and lots of recreational activities including biking and kayaking, with both available for rental. lots of families everywhere, people were putting up hammocks between the many trees and falling asleep in them. There is food available to purchase, big place to sit and eat and enjoy the view of the lake.
Nice dog walking around lake, best during wekday less cycles on another pathway
We love to walk around it or bike around it. Besutiful all year round. Great to see sunsets over the water, or people watch.

name: The Escape Game Minneapolis
address: 300 E Broadway, Bloomington, MN 55425, USA
reviews: We were visiting the mall of America and decided to try this attraction and we had an incredible experience! I took my 8 and 10 year old boys and they had a blast. The skill level was fun and interesting for all of us and I was impressed by how innovative the room was. It wasn’t easy but it wasn’t too hard to make it frustrating or difficult! They helped us out with clues when we needed it and even let us stay for a little extra time to finish “escape” the room since we couldn’t do it in the hour time frame. I really appreciated the friendliness of the staff and their ability to give us a great experience!

Nice Escape Room experience located in the Mall of America.
The prices here are more expensive than some other operators in the area, but I suppose that's to be expected in the MOA.
The staff were all friendly and helpful before, during, and after our mission.
We went through their Prison Escape mission and got out with over 2 minutes remaining!
Definitely a fun way to spend an hour for an experience you'll be talking about long after!

Would defiantly recommend The Escape Game for a fun thing to do with your family or friends. I had a lot of fun solving "The Heist" game. I love a good challenge and this room provided exactly that . Our game guide was Sarah and she did an amazing job. She was very knowledgeable and was able to answer all of my questions.  If you're looking for something fun to do in the Mall of America, be sure to check this place out.

We have enjoyed each game played here. The staff members are awesome and supportive. We have played 4 games with just two of us and escaped from 3. I highly recommend Gold Rush if it's your first game ever as it was for us. Definitely make sure you take advantage of their discounts at the end because you will want to come back! I can't wait to try the one we didn't escape from (The Heist) again and make an attempt at Prison Break!

So much fun. The staff is very helpful, and it's quite necessary that they are. It's a busy sign in area prime time on the weekend. 
We had a group of 8 and we did the heist room. It was very well thought out and so much fun to navigate together. We escaped with 7 minutes left and used about 4 clues. 
Would recommend doing with friends and family for any occasion. Check for Groupons.

name: Basilica of Saint Mary
address: 88 17th St N, Minneapolis, MN 55403, USA
reviews: Beautiful Basilica.  Would recommend getting a guide which can be picked up at the front of the Church for a 2 dollar donation.  Highlights for me were the stained glass, the organ, and the altar area.  Also, there are different types of nativity scenes set up throughout the Church.   There is parking in the back, and plan to spend 30 minutes to see everything.

They are so friendly and generous with how they provide support for low income and homeless individuals. It was great to see the empathy they exhibited towards the guests in need while at the Shoe Ministry. This was a great day for the people I brought to get shoe vouchers, they walked out of there with much more than they could've imagined.

The Basilica of Saint Mary is a beautiful old church. It is well maintained a still an active site of worship. The church has an ornate ceiling and amazing stained glass windows. It is quiet and peaceful upon entering.  If you walk all the way to the back of the Church, you can see the large pipe organ, which extends most of the height of the wall with angel statues around it. It is well worth seeing. The amount of care and detail in everything is wonderful to see.

The home of a vibrant congregation, with a mission of outreach to the community, the Basilica of St. Mary is a place to visit, if not arrange a docent-led tour. With an important history locally and nationally, the church building tells its witness to Mary in its gorgeous stained-glass windows in the two-story nave. The church is filled with iconography on every door panel and wall niche. Furthermore, the church has international worship manifestations, from Our Lady of Guadalupe to a Madonna and Child from Vietnam. This is a church you will want to visit more than once.
There is a lot of beauty inside this place. It draws a big crowd,so maybe we shouldn't have been so surprised to see a number of police securing the entrances. Good close parking across from it.

name: FlyOver America
address: Mall of America, 5120 Center Ct, Bloomington, MN 55425, USA
reviews:
So fun! Very similar to the Soarin' ride at Disney World, but no 'scents' in the air. We had a fun time here with our son. I think it was about 10 minutes (give or take) long and the line was short to get in. It's a separate thing from the Nickelodeon Universe, but right next to it. 

Tip: Sign up for their e-newsletter for occasional deals!

Buy ticket stand in a line.  Move to another room and stand in a different line. They lead you into another room and you stand in a line.  Then someone brings you up a level and you sit down and strap into your seat.  It goes dark and you can tell the seat is moving.  Lights come on and your seat is over the walkway that you walked towards your seat.  Flying across America with wind and mist in your face.  It was awesome!  I glanced over and watched the other spectators seats swaying back and forth.  Well worth the 3 different lines I stood in.  AWESOME.  

Oh, no pics are allowed inside as I bet you would lose your camera.  lol

If you are in Minneapolis and visiting the Mall of America, you got to be at this place! We have been here twice and this place will never cease to amaze us even if we are going to visit this 10 more times.

The check in process is quite simple at the front desk and make sure to look for online discount coupons. The staff direct people well inside the premises and are very helpful.

Coming to the experience, it is SURREAL! Nothing like I have ever experienced before. It’s a fairly 10 minute simulated flying experience over some of the famous landmarks and landscapes of the USA and ends at outside of the earth. The fantastic background music just ups the entire feel of the whole experience!

The best part is the mist u feel on your face as you fly over water bodies and the sweet fragrance as you fly over some prairies. The fighter jets that fly in tandem provide an unbelievable view.

Was a cool experience. Only giving it 4 stars as the attraction itself is very short. I recommend getting both the Fly Over Hawaii and America package, as they were both interesting. The attraction itself is very interactive with wind, movement, mist, and smells.

I've taken the kids to Disney world and Disneyland several times, and this rates right up there with my all time favorite attractions! My 21 year old daughter, and my 4 & 7 year old grandchildren absolutely loved it as well - so much that they chose this over the theme park on our second day visit to Mall of America. If you haven't had the opportunity to go on this attraction yet, I hope you'll plan a visit - it was fantastic!

name: Western Sculpture Park
address: 387 Marion St, St Paul, MN 55103, USA
reviews: Enjoyed the different pieces, although I would have liked to know more about each piece and their artist
It was cool...but seemed to be a uncomfortable amount of sculptures.
I live coming here...a little Haven in the city.  For all you Pokemon hunters this is a great stop.
Lovely sculptures but needed to be cleaned up a bit. I was comfortable but other visitors stated not to go too far into the park due to a fight in the yard.

There aren't a lot of sculptures. Plus, the a sculptures are not all that. Also, it takes like 2 hours to get there by bus. It's not worth it considering that there are about 5 or 6 sculptures. I actually think I can see all the sculptures in the photo. I'll take a pic next time I'm in that area.

name: The Museum of Russian Art
address: 5500 Stevens Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55419, USA
reviews: Loved it! I really wanted to see the Holiday display but I couldn't make it work. The Chernobyl photos are intense. The Soviet posters are amazing. It was fun to use Google Translate and the camera to translate the Russian. A smaller place with 3 floors right off 35 and Diamond Lake road. Staff was friendly. Free on-street parking. I'd definitely go back!

We have visited here several times and enjoyed every visit. This time we participated in a docent led visit. It was excellent. We particularly enjoyed the exhibits of the Russian Posters, the Chernobyl nuclear disaster photos, and the art on loan from the Hill Monastic Library at St. john's University.

This place is a hidden gem of a museum. I've driven past it hundreds of times and never thought about it until one evening when I thought of dropping by.

The propaganda posters are amazing. You can easily see the mindset of Russia sitting the Cold War era.
Down stairs is the old Russia of the tzar's. They have some amazing pieces that were presents to them, or from them. Wonderful craftsmanship. 

I was told that the displays change several times a year, which will bring me back in a few months to see what's there.
Go check it out and support your local museums!

Fantastic place for those with ties to, or interested in, Russian culture. Art galleries are always well curated, displaying both historic and modern Russian art pieces. Additionally the museum often hosts speakers, cultural events, performances, and celebrations. Well worth a visit, or several.

One of my favorite museums ever. They have a constantly changing set of exhibits so there's always something new to see. It's big enough to make it worth your time but not so big you have to plan an entire day around visiting.

name: The St. Paul Grill
address: 350 N Market St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Absolutely the best place we ate in in the twin cities! Iconic and steeped in history! Classy with liveried waiters- old school- awesome! Fit for a special occasion! Really superb! Charles was our waiter and he was as lovely as the restaurant! Definitely one to go back to again! You get a choice of regular table and booths! Pricey but worth it!! 50-60 bucks per person with a drink, main and a side!
Wow! What a great place for a drink. I didn't get the two bartenders names last night. But they were both phenomenal. We'll be back for dinner and more drinks.

We came here on our mini moon when we stayed at the St paul hotel. This is well worth coming here for dinner. They have the best french onion soup I've found to date. They have a vast selection of wine and spirits to choose from. Steak reigns supreme here and you can get it with so many toppings and made just to your liking. They also have a lot of other great cuts of meats to choose from. It does get busy so make sure to get your reservation in and in advanced just to be safe.

The St Paul Grill is a good place, but not the best, and it really should be. We have eaten here on several occasions as we stayed at the St Paul Hotel. They do have a great variety of dishes, the wild rice soup is always a good choice. Honestly I have just never been overly impressed with any steaks I have had, I am however very picky and even more so when paying top dollar. Worth a try but not sure it’s worth the prices.

We went for brunch and it was so so good. Not your average breakfast. The caramel pecan roll was amazing. And so we're the creamy hashbrowns. We were a little nervous about bringing my 18 month old to such a fancy restaurant with but she was welcomed and staff were patient with her. We will be back for brunch again!

name: Red Cow
address: 393 Selby Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: What a lovely place.  Very busy and parking is a real mess. However, it is really worth it.  The food was amazing. Bison burger with figs and fresh tomato soup. Drinks were perfectly made as requested. The staff are very friendly.  Be prepared to wait for seating, even at the bar.

The food was excellent. I had the root beer pulled pork, which was excellent. Others in my group ordered the 60/40 burger and the Manhattan burger, and we're also very pleased. Many of the burgers came on pretzel buns, which were not as dense/heavy as some pretzel buns. Service was quick and excellent, would highly recommend. Also, the chips and french onion dip (a Food Network Top 50 Dip) was incredible! Definitely try it!
We were here for a happy hour/dinner with office friends. Being a vegetarian I took veg burger and sweet potato fries. Friends also tried different burgers and we all had good time here.

Excellent food, friendly and attentive staff.
They have some of the best burgers in the cities, bit this last time I went I had the Reuben. 

Their Reuben was pure heaven. Perfectly portioned. They corned beef was incredible and the sauerkraut was fresh and full of flavor. 

I will continue to patron this establishment for as long as they keep up the quality.

This was the best brunch I’ve possibly ever had. Bloody Mary with the perfect kick to it and homemade pickles on top. Salmon Benedict with a dill hollandaise and perfectly oozing eggs was to die for. Beautiful scenery from out table outside and fast service.

name: Tongue in Cheek
address: 989 Payne Ave, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews: Stop by this establishment for the first time on February 16, 2020 was one of the best breakfast I’ve ever had. The staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast food was amazing. It did take a while for the food to come out but it was well worth the wait. If you get a chance please stop by.

It's been awhile since we've been back and we're really glad we gave it another chance. Food options, food prep, drinks and service have always been great but the last time we visited the place was CRAZY loud. My wife has wanted to go back a number of times but I've always been apprehensive due to our last experience (mind you it's now been years at this point since our last visit). This time it was much quieter. Not sure if it's that it was a Sunday evening and not super busy or they've got sound absorbing panels now or what but we really enjoyed ourselves and we able to carry a conversation without feeling like we were yelling at one another. We'll definitely be back sooner based on this experience.

I love Tongue in Cheek and I thoroughly enjoy coming here for brunch here on Sundays. Their menu is eclectic and unusual which is exactly what I strive for in anything I go out to eat. I usually order the pork belly ramen or variations of eggs Benedict which never disappoint. My boyfriend is obsessed with the chicken and waffles and craves them constantly. You can get coffee, a cocktail, a couple appetizers and a brunch dish for around $25-29 I believe, and it’s all so deliciously worthwhile. The atmosphere is hip and awesome. Everyone is always having a great time and the mood is good. 
I highly recommend this little gem!

Visited for brunch when I was in town last November with a friend. SOOOO GOOD!! Service was great, my food (and drink!) was delicious. I had the braised pork eggs Benedict (I literally try eggs Benedict everywhere I go) and the house Bloody Mary. The atmosphere was great, parking was fairly easy and I had a great brunch with my friend! I will definitely be back

Nice little gem, the location is a turn off because its located in a really sketchy part of town.  The ambiance was relaxing.  Nice place for a date night.  Food was small in portion, but very classy and up scaled.  Friendly staff, and overall amazing place.  Pork belly was amazing!!!!!

name: Meritage
address: 410 St Peter St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: We came to this place for lunch. we heard about this spot from many people.  Well, it was very nice. we were warmly welcomed by the staff members  and we had an excellent feeling. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. we highly recommend this place.

Perfect place to go on a cold winter day!

ORDERED ITEMS: OUT OF 5
CHICKEN SOUP W/ MATZO BALLS: 5
My first time trying this legendary item. My favorite part was the doll complimenting the chicken broth. I didn't think it would do much but it was just perfect. The Matzo balls are soft and every bite is a spoon of comfort for the soul. I could have had 5 bowls!

BAKED SALMON LUNCH SPECIAL:4
I love capers and the broth/sauce beneath the salmon was hearty and delicious. 

SPICED HONEY CIDER:5
I nursed this drink for a very long time. I chose a hot drink and it tasted just as good even cold. The perfect non alcoholic drink on a cold MN day!

Bravo Meritage!

This place is no doubt one of the tastiest restaurants in the region. Every time I visit this place I am greatly happy. They manage their very high  level service and the topmost level of food  they give. You definitely will enjoy this this place. Very  recommended.
Pretty good French bistro, with solid food offerings all around.  Decent happy hour. At times More expensive than its peers but given its location, not unexpected.

Best place to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary!  Staff was AMAZING,  attentive  and took care of EVERY detail!  Food was mouth watering, had superb presentation and exceeded expectations!  Make your reservations NOW!

name: Pazzaluna Urban Italian Restaurant
address: 360 St Peter St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
Overall very good experience.  Giving 4 stars because there wasn't anything that WOW'd the wife and I - it was very good, but not amazing.  Also because my wife drank less than half of her strawberry (grenadine) lemonade and couldn't finish it because she didn't like the taste.  And because they add a 3% fee to cover "increased wages for great employees" that's not required and you can ask your server to remove. It just felt weird to be automatically charged this random extra fee instead of raising menu prices for example.  We asked to have it removed and used it as a portion of the tip to the waiter instead.

I had the crab stuffed salmon (one of the evening's specials) and my wife had the stuffed ravioli.  We both finished our plates and were very happy.  Again, they were both very good, don't get me wrong, but nothing awesome/unique to brag about.
The only item that excited me was the bread - very soft on the inside and I loved the cheese crusting.  I wish they would have served it with the traditional olive oil and Parmesan cheese though - we didn't like the crushed olive "dip", but neither of us like olives much.

Great atmosphere - we liked the decor and especially the high ceilings.  Service was excellent.  Quick and friendly.

It was a $100 bill for the two of us and at the price, I think we will try somewhere else next time.  I feel like I could get a similar very good solid meal at Olive Garden for $60-80.

Checked reviews, had to stop by!
GREAT CHOICE!  Bread is amazing, very nice wine selection, Pizza is excellent!:))
Fantastic atmosphere and ambiance!   Very pleasant staff.
Nicole H took great care of me w/ spot on recommendations and great service, and conversation.  
This is a gem....try it...trust me!
Great experience on Valentine's day. Every course was delicious and the drink pairings were on point. The portions were perfect I would love to come back on another day with a similar menu setup.

This place is pretty good but a little expensive. They were however, very accommodating. To start, the bread is absolutely delicious. For a salad, I recommend the Caesar salad. The Chicken Parmesan was okay but the Spaghetti Carbonara was amazing. I do not drink alcohol but their list is extensive. Dress nice!

Pazzaluna is upscale Italian with the price tag to show it.  The food is good and the service is great.  The beet salad I had was delicious.  But after just having returned from Italy the meal was over double the cost for a similar meal in Tuscany.  Something seems wrong about that.

name: Highland Grill
address: 771 Cleveland Ave S, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: Steak and perogies: TO DIE FOR. this menu item was so good it makes me want to come back for more or order seconds. This is my first time coming here but what an amazing experience! Very nice inside and menu prices are very fair. Madison was my server and she's very delightful, definitely a good experience with her! I will be back 👌

First time here was fall 2019. Randomly chose it to meet up with an old friend.

Food: Everything was delicious and looked appetizing!

Customer service: Attentive and friendly server.

Parking: Had to find parking on the street but it was a nice brief walk to the restaurant.

Seating: It was perfect weather to eat outside. 

Overall: Would choose this as a meetup place to eat and catch up. Also, if you went to school in this area, there’s a high chance of running into some lovely people from college!

We have been to the great Highland Grill many times. Stopped in for lunch today and enjoyed the grilled watermelon salad and the steak and perogies.. what a treat! My husband and I highly recommend both dishes! We left satisfied and wanting even more! Thank you again, Highland Grill! We will be back again soon!

After dropping my husband off at the airport at 8 a.m. I googled "best breakfast near me". In the list of possibilities was the Highland Grill. As I walked in I felt the intimate setting and headed straight to the breakfast counter for my seat. I was immediately greeted by server Rachael. My preferred, decaf coffee, with real cream served in the old fashioned little pitcher was great!. I ordered the All American Breakfast. Perfectly cooked eggs and crispy hashbrowns. The toast was thick, crusty and had a gooood amount of butter on it! I love me some butter! The bacon was generous and smokey flavored. It was my first time there,  but not my last!! Next time I'll stop for a cocktail and try an evening entree as all the pictures from reviews look fantastic!
The Hot Hash & Holly is tremendous! I was pleased that you could grab a coffee next door if wanted. The staff is attentive and the food is amazing. Need I say more?

name: Pajarito
address: 605 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
Hit and miss. A few flashes of brilliance here and there - that sweet potato dish!  They certainly have skills and create some real crowd pleasing dishes. And it’s mostly perfectly fine. But it’s nothing more than slightly above average updated Mexican food. Dinner was definitely better than lunch.  

It’s a fun space, great vibe and great staff. Food is good, sometimes great, sometimes less than good.

ringing in at $9 these fish tacos were perfect in every way. perfectly battered and lightly crisp and still hot from the fryer and balanced but the crunch of apple and cabbage. tortillas could be a little better but overall cannot complain. wish i had more room to try the salsa options.

Amazing salsa and guacamole! Fantastic cocktails!

This place gets BUSY on Saturday nights, but the servers do a grade A job still being attentive to their patrons.

My guy got a barbacoa taco that he enjoyed. I insisted we get the yucca fries (as I always do when I see them on the menu), and they weren't awful but a bit too starchy for my taste.

We would definitely go back to try more.
I really enjoyed Pajarito. The location is quaint, the flavors are amazing! I loved the Brussels sprouts. The prices are slightly high in my opinion, and the service could have been better.
Very nice modern and not pretentious Mexican style fine-dining.  Great selection of tacos, fresh made chips and top notch salsas. Ask for recommendations and you wont go wrong.

name: Kincaid's Fish, Chop & Steakhouse
address: 380 St Peter St Suite 125, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Our first time to this lovely establishment but not our last.  We made reservations and the hostess was just fantastic.  We sat in the bar area waiting for our table and ordered drinks. The drinks were amazing but the staff that work there are beyond outstanding.  We were seated at a lovely table and the food was a delicious treat from beginning to end.  The baked brie was perfect to start things off.  The prime rib dinner was perfection. The steak dinner was beyond delicious.  Dessert with coffee ended one of the best meals we’ve ever had in the Twin Cities.   But it was the excellent customer service that really made the dinner incredible.

Exceptional service. All of our food was beyond amazing (perfectly cooked & exquisitely prepared/presented). 

Drinks were A+. Our server and hostess were fantastic. 

Go here! Perfect romantic spot for a luxury dinner.
This place was amazing. The staff was excellent and the food was amazing. Their cask aged old fashioned was one of the best I have ever had. It was our first time here, but will definitely go back.
Delicious happy hour menu selections. The sampler was perfect for 2. Nice red wine as a complement at a reasonable price.

Kincaid’s has changed ownership and has changed a few things. While I miss a few of the old menu items, many of the classics remain. Service was great, atmosphere is still one of the best. Food photos will speak for themselves!

name: Downtowner Woodfire Grill
address: 253 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
We went here for an early supper before the hockey game .  The restaurant is eye catching as soon as you walk in .  Looks really high end .
We ordered the wood fired mushroom dip and the fried shrimp and calamari for appetizers.   Not a heavy breading on the shrimp and calamari.   Just enough to coat it and it was fantastic.  Mushroom dip was ok .  Nothing special. 
I ordered the swordfish kabob .  Swordfish was good and  cooked well .  The plate come with a pile of white rice .  Bland and no flavor to it .

Excellent food and service.  Stopped by the Downtowner before a Wild game and it was nice to see I wasn't the only fan who had that idea.  If you are a fan of pizza, the pizza here is great.  The wood fire style they make adds an extra level to the pizza.  I had the chicken, mushroom and smoked mozzarella and it was one of the better pizzas I have had.  I will definitely come back, especially if I am going to a Wild game and want to get something to eat before the game!
Guac appetizer excellent. Walleye sandwich outstanding. (Cooked over wood) Only issue: Stella from tap was not cold. Otherwise a great place to eat.

This place is probably one of the best places for the price point you can find in Saint Paul,  They have great steaks but I would highly recommend the sword fish as well, also if its in season they do amazing things with halibut. This is a really good date spot as well a good spot to get a nice meal before a wild game or concert, I haven't tried they're lunch yet but since there prices are really reasonable I would give it a go. The one thing I will say is that they're appetizers are true appetizers, they are meant to be a very light start to the meal  as opposed to most bar appetizers which are often can be a meal in themselves for one person, just be aware that  of that when getting apps.

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants. The food, service and value was among the best other restaurants around. There is also complimentary parking in one of two lots. Unfortunately, we had a poor experience there last night. So bad that I'm unsure I will go there again. Perhaps it was a fluke experience given the large parties related to the Final Four, but the entire staff just seemed a bit off and the dining experience for the special event we were celebrating was sullied. 

The server was not attentive. It took a long time to even get our orders taken. We had to ask/beg three times before any bread came out. No new silverware was provided or offered after salad/bread, or even after one piece of silverware fell (accidentally) on the ground. The server saw it and still didn't offer new silverware, but seemed perturbed by the situation. 

Dishes lingered and were not cleared promptly. Refills on drinks were incredibly slow. A non-dairy/allergy friendly food request was not honored, despite the fact the server indicated it could have been. There was no offer for dessert or after meal drinks, and I believe I know why. When we got up from the table, staff zoomed over to prep the table for another group. It appeared that the restaurant had overlapping reservations. 

In two meals, the main dish meat was undercooked to the point a good portion of the dishes were not eaten. No one ever asked us how things were after the good arrived (the server and manager historically do), and it was clear the server was content to extract the obligatory 20% gratuity based on our group size. I have no problem tipping well, but when you get incredibly poor service, particularly for a special event you are celebrating, that's an inappropriate tip amount.

Overall, I really was disappointed with our latest dining experience and how it diminished the special event that we were celebrating. I am hopeful that this was a one time off experience. I am torn on whether to give the restaurant another chance.

name: La Grolla
address: 452 Selby Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: A great spot for Italian in St.Paul. Classy intimate vibes, offering tasteful Italian dishes cooked with care. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves great Italian food at a good price in a nice quiet setting.

Great service and very reasonably priced. The food was good (no major complaints), but it wasn't anything special. The dishes we had all lacked a little flavor and were more on the bland side. There are several other Italian restaurants in the MSP area that I would recommend above.

Food was amazing, all the creme sauces are great. I've been here twice and both have been great experiences. One of the dishes came cold and they immediately replaced it with a fresh one free of charge. Great service all around.

My husband and I visited La Grolla a few weeks ago on a whim. The location was great and the ambiance was quaint and romantic. We both had pasta dishes and they were delicious. The bruschetta that we started with was probably my my favorite part of the meal. Be sure to check this restaurant out!
Amazing food for an amazing price!! You get your money’s worth for the food- it’s the perfect size. Everything is delicious, and probably some of the best pasta I’ve ever had.

name: Colossal Cafe
address: 2315 Como Ave, St Paul, MN 55108, USA
reviews: Colossal Cafe is our popular pick-up spot for scones & croissant muffins. Daily sweet & savory scones keep us coming back for more. Breakfast is so good with huge serving sizes. Sourdough toast off the flattop is mouth watering. If you have room for dessert get a "flip"! Beyond yummy!!

Decided to check this out because it made the top Eaters twin cities list. Cute place. Loved meeting the owner and seeing how much love and care he puts into the place. 

I enjoyed the atmosphere and seating, cozy home feel to it which I appreciate. 

I had the mushroom, spinach, provolone omelette and the hubby had the apple, walnut, brie full stack flappers. 

The omelette had a creamy sauce which was a pleasant treat. Their homemade pineapple habanero sauce definitely has a kick to it and complemented the eggs well. For some reason, and despite all this, it still tasted a bit bland for my taste buds. 

The flappers are extremely filling. The pancakes are made with yeast, which I'd never tried before. I wouldn't have thought to mix apple with walnuts and brie on a pancake and it is a burst of flavor in your mouth. I enjoyed trying something new and like when places get creative with food. 

Overall a neat spot to try out.

Love colossal!!! It’s a neighborhood gem that serves delicious food at reasonable prices. The owners and employees are wonderful and I’ve never had a bad experience in the 7 years we’ve lived in SAP, eating at the Como location.

Very nice brunch place. Loved their homemade biscuits. They are huge, soft and they melt in the mouth. Their biscuits and gravy is to die for - strongly recommend them. Omelettes are light, fluffy with great options. Pastries are awesome too. 

Many vegetarian options available. Do try their wild mushroom gravy!! It's terrific! 

Overall nice and cozy Cafe in Como with good ambience and great food! 😍

This is a small, busy place with a unique waitlist. Customers order their food as a table, wait until an actual table opens up, then sit down, which is when the kitchen starts cooking your food, since you don't really have a server assigned to you. Tipping is confusing in this set up and since the place is so small, the tables are very snug together--anytime someone wants to move, they need to ask someone at a table next to them to move too. The food, however, is great! I've been twice and both times, thoroughly enjoyed brunch. Their known for their homemade colossal-sized biscuits and flappers (yeasted pancakes). I recommend the roasted vegetable omelette.

name: Tavern on Grand
address: 656 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: This place has a nice bar, and serves great food... well known for walleye sandwiches, grilled, breaded or blackened. Plenty of other choices, too.  Great atmosphere, parking out back. Historic! Go! Enjoy!

Good nachos and a wide variety of walleye themed dishes. Service was good and there was a fairly traditional American beer variety. More options for potatoes than I've ever seen at a restaurant. All in all, a worthwhile place to eat if you're in the area.

The bartender Drew is really friendly! I also noticed he kept his cool when it got busy because he still managed to get peoples drinks quickly. Super impressive. I hope to go back when he’s working again!

Quaint interior, excellent staff, and great tastes. I visited for a private event and the food and drink were excellent, I highly recommend their walleye! The bar also has a good selection of beers including some local beers. Staff were very kind and attentive. I will definitely be back again soon

I come to this special place often  as I enjoy the good mood that is exist in this place. The staff is very loving and professional. The service is exceptionally quick. Needless to say, the food you eat is perfect. I ate there many times and I was always satisfied. The price is decent. I recommend this place to to all.

name: Brasa Premium Rotisserie
address: 777 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: Been coming here for a few years now and honestly this is one of few restaurants I can say NEVER disappoint. The food is super flavorful, the pricing is more than fair, and the staff is super friendly. Plus, I never in my life thought "Hot Pepper Vinegar" would ever be something that I crave, but this place has done that to me. Plain and simple if you want amazing tasting food that hits the spot and doesn't break the bank this place is for you.

A true MSP gem - Brasa does it right with original, delicious, perfectly executed, yet unpretentious, comfort food. The only problem we ever face is trying to narrow down what to order.  That said, here are a few recommendations: crispy yucca, plantains (we're partial to the green variety), smoked beef and brunch bowls. Enjoy!

Yum yum!! Came here for lunch Delicious pulled chicken it was tender, flavorful the fish! Was so soft! 
The corn bread needed more butter and honey haha
But the fried plantains was 💪🏼

Solid pricing for great flavor. I've always liked Brasa but until recently it wasn't a place I'd normally go into. It's super casual and I wouldn't stop in on a night out. Their happy hour specials are top notch, some of the best deals in the city.
Favorite restaurant in the TC. Light & vibrant little joint. Generous portions, good prices & great service! (Thanks Henry)

name: Mancinis Char House
address: 531 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
Mancinis is the classic old school supper club with steaks and service that are impeccable.  They have a dining area that's meant for large gathering or intimate couple conversation.  It's my favorite restaurant of all that I've been too.  Awesome food, wonderful ambiance, and lovely staff.  Their success is well deserved - and when Nick, the founder of this one-of-a-kind place, passed away (😢  his presence is still felt there - yet his presence is deeply missed)  - his sons have done an amazing job of keeping Mancinis legendary reputation alive.  Nick must be unspeakably proud.  💞

Thank you, Mancinis crew, for ensuring that this incredible restaurants character remains unchanged.  There isn't another place like yours and there never will be!  💞💞

Traveling the area with some family. Popped in for a drink and shrimp. This place is awesome! Love the decor and old fashioned steak house and lounge feeling. The staff are friendly and attentive. The other patrons were having fun and sharing stories of Mancini’s from days last.  I throughly enjoyed my visit. The shrimp cocktail was amazing. The grasshopper drink was made perfect. Haven’t one of those since the mid 90s at a small steakhouse in my hometown. Great memories. If you’re in the area, go visit this place. You won’t be disappointed.

Large building, throwback feel in a dim setting. Staff was great. I ordered a sirloin steak and was given bowl of veggies, break and salad. All great and sure to make you stuffed before main meal. Steak itself was cooked to order but felt quality of meat to be average.
Awesome place. Excellent food and Pat Mancini is a great host. We are old friends from school and he always treats us right. If you haven't been there you need to go! Best steak and lobster in town!

I went for a wedding reception. Great food and drinks. The steak was amazing! They have very attentive staff and fast service at the bar. There was a live band playing and a dance floor. It was a really fun atmosphere.

name: The Nook
address: 492 Hamline Ave S, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: I've been to the Nook before, however, I never had gone to their basement level. It was very fun down there. And I enjoyed to see their bowling alley where people were having a lot of fun. I was at the bar and they had a great happy hour. Draft beers for two and $3! You can't beat that. Next time I want to go a little earlier when I can have a burger and fries too.

The food was really good. The nook curds are super good and the original nookie burger was awesome too! Only negative is it's a small building and our buzzer went off so they took us downstairs to a table but someone else sat down at it. They made us go back upstairs and wait an additional 10 minutes before getting seated after already waiting 20 minutes.

Lately I have begun to worry that the soul is nothing more than what the imagination does with inner experience. The place from which your life flows is incalculably deep. In none of my visits to the Nook have donuts been available. Nor, I suppose, have they been unavailable, as the good people of this establishment do not present themselves as purveyors of donuts. The donuts are absent, and I feel their absence deeply. But when I grow weary, the wings carry me to higher ground.

One of the very best burgers and very best fries in the whole Twin Cities.  Also a great environment... don't forget the old bowling alleys downstairs. A great place to relax and have a good time with good food.  Great wings too. This is an old, old favorite of ours. It's been great for many years.

**The service I received during my last visit was maybe worth 1 star but I enjoy this place typically.**

My friends from out of town visited during the holidays so I wanted to bring her somewhere unique. When we got to the nook it was a steady pace. Not extremely busy but not dead either. We asked to sit in the basement. We were sat and greeted 5 minutes later. I was ready to order a drink at that time but the others were still browsing. The server took my order and left for about 10 minutes before bring back my beer.
Rather than asking if the others wanted something to drink he quickly walked away and went to a table nearby that had just sat. He took all of their drink orders, went to the bar to put them in, waited for the drinks and then returned to the table to take their food orders.... we had been sitting for 20 minutes at this point with no drinks or food orders for my friends.  He continued to walk past our table so I flagged him down to pay for my beer so we could leave. He took the card and came back and said "it's on me" and turned away. It was a bummer and a little embarrassing.

name: Skyva Deli
address: 55 5th St E #204, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: The food is fresh and SO tasty. My new favorite lunch stop. The service is excellent, too. Nice variety on the menu, and great prices. I can't say enough good things about this place!

When my go-to Deli closed in this food court (the Nectary) I needed to find a new place for my Sandwich, Wrap, Salad and Soup cravings. Skyva has filled that void nicely! They have a wide range of options and everything I have tried has been good. They also have mutliple daily specials. Today I tried the Cuban Special which came on a pita wrap loaded with delicious pork, ham and provolone. I will be getting that again. My goto is usually the Spicy Chicken Sandwich. The staff is always friendly and they move quickly.
Fresh, delicious and quick! 5 stars doesn't do justice. Amazing customer service, tasty but more importantly fresh and healthy lunch at an affordable price.

At the first moment  you step in that place  they give you a good feeling. Very friendly waiters, it is a good restaurant to go out with buddies or with your date. enjoyable  cooking, experienced  chef, competitive  pay and generous  service. Warmly recommended.

So I read the reviews. Had to find out for meself. Soup sounded fab this cold, blustery Thursday morning. Got the Chicken Poblano bowl + Spicy Chicken sandwich to go.

Excellent choices, both. Soup was flavourful, rich, mm MM good! Sandwich tapped all my taste buds, and then some...💯👌🏾👍🏾

Brandon et familia (pictured) prepped this yummy grub from scratch, even though it wasn’t quite opening time for them. Truly, truly nice people...🙏🏽

Next up, Mac & Cheese Friday @ Skyva!

name: Parlour St. Paul
address: 267 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
Top three things:
1.  The burger, of course, one of the best in the Twin Cities
2.  The fried cauliflower - plenty of flavor
3.  Popcorn - really great to share with the table

Things I wish I knew ahead of time:
1.  At the time we went, the burger bun did not have a gluten free option
2.  Scrambled eggs here are an amazing option
3.  No parking lot, so metered street parking is your best bet

; We entered on a quiet Sunday night close to 9PM. With three rooms connected for seating, Parlour had plenty of seating available. The ambiance, cozy and elegant. 

We ordered the simple burgers, smash burger style, which were great. I was a bit disappointed that I wasn't able to add a fried egg to my burger, but no biggie - sunny side up will do just fine. The two large potato French fry order is definitely shareable, possibly even between three people. I highly recommend the garlic aioli for the fries, if you're into that sorta of thing.

Their in-house old fashioned cocktail bites and STRONG!

Staff was great the moment we walked in. Hostess was patient with us. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The rest of the staff acknowledged and thanked us as we walked out the restaurant.

Overall, it's been a great experience. We'll be returning and check out the other location.

Much larger than the Minneapolis one but still the same great food. Honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had (Parlour Burger). Brought my dad and by end of dinner he was talking when we were going to go again. Highly recommend and will be back.

Another City Tin coaster in the books. Dined at Parlour Bar St. Paul. Enjoyed the uniqueness of popcorn fried in bacon fat and coated in pineapple dust. I thought the meat blend in the burger was top notch but the $14.50 price point for just the burger did seem a bit high. Fresh cut fries were a table favorite. Cider was tart and I am a fan of that so two thumbs up from me there.

My friends and I tried this place because we heard that they have the best burgers in town. I was also cautiously optimistic because whenever I go to any restaurant know for their signature food item they always seem to cut corners on everything else.

I got their Parlour Burger and added a friend egg and bacon. It was amazing considering that it was just meat and cheese! The sign of a good burger is that it doesn't rely on 10 extra fixings to be delicious.  My extras definitely leveled up my burger, but I would've been just as happy without them. 

The bread and butter pickles were flavorful, crunchy, and generous! And the hand cut fries were awesome too - crispy outside, soft inside, and perfectly seasoned.

The staff was super friendly and our food arrived surprisingly quickly, but it was also 10:30 a.m. on a Saturday. I couldn't find any fault with anything. My whole experience was just that good!

name: Mama's Pizza
address: 961 Rice St, St Paul, MN 55117, USA
reviews: We have been going to Mamas for years, its always a trip as we live 90min away. Last night was our first time visiting since this pandemic started, and decided to try the take out only. We were not disappointed! Still the same amazing food and amazing service they are known for! Keep up the great work, such a fantastic restaurant!

This place was absolutely amazing. They had great staff that was very communicative and was there whenever we needed a refill. We had delicious meals that filled us up and gave us left overs. At the end we even got some delicious complimentary ice cream cones. They were so cute!

We’ve lived nearby for about 5 years and finally decided to dine here. We were not disappointed! The food was delicious and the prices are super reasonable for the amount of food you get. We enjoyed it so much we went back the next week. We sat at the bar and the two bartenders were friendly and it was obvious they enjoy their job. Will definitely be returning.

Mama's has been s Saint Paul staple for as long as I can remember. Fantastic food on the entire menu and the portions are GIGANTIC! Super friendly staff and very intimate atmosphere. If you're interested the neighborhood you absolutely must stop in. You won't be disappointed.

I've been going to Mama's since the 70s best little mom and pop Italian restaurant great antipasto salad with house dressing any pasta or dago order with extra cheese the meal is covered in mozzarella cheese pizzas are thin crust they offer wine and beer, and a complimentary vanilla cone for dessert.  Mama's has never been a let down.  Please enjoy.

name: W. A. Frost and Company
address: 374 Selby Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: W. A. frost is a must to check out. The food is awesome and what a cool place. Areas in the basement to tuck a small party into, have some drinks and appetizers near a fire. Private bathrooms, a patio, private rooms are beautiful. Staff are professional and friendly. They have a bar that has plenty of spirits to choose from.

Unique, delicious restaurant with a historic twist and inventive food. My wife and I came here on our 13 anniversary because we ate here for one of our first nice dates years ago. The plates have only gotten better. The patio is amazing. The service also great. We are vegetarian and loved our options. Try the bruschetta for a sure win, the celery and fennel for something interesting, and the wild mushroom pasta for a killer main course. We loved our meals and will definitely be back for another celebration.

One more City Tin coaster done. WA Frost & Company in the Cathedral Hill neighborhood for brunch today. Admittedly, I did not love the Dutch Baby Pancake. Figs and lemon were good, but pancake was dry and needed more honey. This is not a slight against the establishment as a whole because the ambience was top notch and many other food items looked great.

This a converted early 1900's pharmacy. This place has great food and ambiance with a historic flair. The food is great with a varied menu for all tastes. There is a restaurant and a bar and lounge. The bar has great drinks for the traditionalist and for the adventurous as well as for the nondrinkers. Great place to sit and relax.  Great place to take someone new to the area.
The speakeasy is a unique place to sit and have a drink and enjoy company after dinner.

name: Shish
address: 1668 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews:
Nice authentic Mediterranean themed restaurant. The host-server was courteous and welcoming. Food was great with few nice touches. They have good menu options and quality/quantity of portion was also good. 

They have nice vegetarian options and Turkish coffee is a must try. Ambiance is nice and cozy which adds up to your mood.

Outstanding COVID-19 safety measures! I ordered and paid online. Convenient parking was readily available. The door was blocked open, so that I didn't even have to touch it to go in. The staff greeted me from a distance as I picked up my order from a table just inside the door. I touched nothing but my order. GREAT PLANNING for keeping people safe and healthy! I super-appreciate businesses that are doing this well!

i have decided to stop coming here since my last visit. im not sure if it has new ownership since the renovation in 2019, but the food is no where near as awesome as it used to be. prices have gone up and the food quality has gone way way down. makes absolutely no sense. i wont spend money here anymore. it was good while it lasted.

We like a lot eating out. Last night we went to this magnificent restaurant which we didn’t know before. We passed a beautiful time there with great food and  an experienced team and a distinguished chief cook. We  added this venue in our phone list  and we shall certainly visit again soon. We highly recommend.

Came here for dinner with my sister on a weeknight. Super fresh food with great flavors. I had the chicken pita and my sister had the chicken wrap. We shared the cauliflower to start and it was absolutely delicious.
The pita was a bit messy but worth the mess.
Nice clean atmosphere that was a great place to catch up.
Prices are very reasonable. I'm looking forward to going back and hopefully trying some of the desserts that looked awesome!

name: Shamrocks
address: 995 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: I adore this place! They provide fantastic dishes, their menu is rich, The cook in that place is very trained, I enjoy a lot eating all their food. The dishes are always of high class, the attitude towards the visitors  is agreeable. I often go to  this restaurant and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend it to all my friends.

Awesome spot. Liz was a great server! Mouthwatering Lucy burgers (albeit a tad smaller than your typical burger), cheap rail drinks, vibrant atmosphere, cool decor and big tvs. Psst...they have milkshakes too!

I’ve been coming here for years. Sadly, our pickup order tonight was extremely under par. We usually love it, but we were extremely underwhelmed. Our burgers were overcooked, and flavorless. So disappointed.

Shamrock's (and the Nook, which is owned by the same people) has THE best cheeseburger in the Twin Cities. And I've tried a lot of the cheeseburgers these towns have to offer. The fries are also fantastic, with a little darker color and skins on. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Still one of my favorite places ever. Got the Paul Molitor, again. Switched it up and got the sweet potato fries with the chipotle ranch. Such a phenomenal meal. Great beer and drink options as well. Love coming back.

name: Capitol View Cafe & Catering
address: 637 Smith Ave S, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews:
This place is absolutely amazing. The food is amazing 
(I'd suggest the loaded Belgian waffle. It's a Belgian waffle with bananas, strawberries, blueberries, and whipped cream)
If you get a coffee they stop by to refill it when it gets low.
The people who work there are also fantastic.

The staff works hard, and the food typically comes quick.  We get the TexMex which is layered hash browns, scrambled eggs, onions, choice of meat, tortilla, enchilada sauce and a dollop of sour cream.  It's fantastic.  The coffee is super, and super strong!  Prices are market appropriate.  They add a surcharge for credit cards, which is posted.
Always delicious and generously portioned food. During this lockdown I am prioritizing supporting this fine West Side institution and I hope you do the same. Great business and great food.

First ever experience with Capitol View Cafe was unlike any other first time at a new place to eat.

The wait staff was truly amazing, warm and welcoming. All of the staff were polite and prompt.

Now the best part, the food. Hands down, the best food ever. Hot, flavorful and definitely homestyle. Large portions and flat out amazing.

Definitely will be returning!!
Great place for breakfast.   Nice service and convenient location.  Lots of good memories here!

name: Saint Dinette
address: 261 5th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: This place is the gift that keeps on giving. The menu changes always bring great new dishes to try while the staples remain. You won’t eat a bigger cheeseburger anywhere else. Their drinks are perfectly crafted. The staff is always gracious and the owners are great people. Highly recommend this spot for dinner or brunch. Don’t leave without ordering flapjacks for dessert

Very nice and cozy place with large windows. Great service and friendly staff. Fair prices relative to the style. The brunch is excellent; eggs Benedict and avocado toast were awesome. Great coffee. Brûlée grapefruit was a nice sweet taste to finish with. Will definitely go back there!

What a cute little place! I had never heard of it before until my daughter asked me to go to dinner with her at the restaurant. Very nicely greeted. Small but delicious menu. We each got an entree and a side to share. A small and unfamiliar wine selection so I took a chance on a red blend and it was wonderful! Lost one star because waiter was not as attentive as I would have liked. But overall nice place that I would return to.

Great burgers in a unique location. The simplicity of their burgers is the key to their success. Their fries are also amongst the best we have ever tried. Will definitely visit them for brunch again. Before going to the farmers market or a Saints game.
One of my favorite St. Paul restaurants. With this pandemic,  they have converted some of their great sandwiches and sides into a great take out value for couples and families.

name: Mucci's Italian
address: 786 Randolph Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: This restaurant is tucked away in a neighborhood but serves up delicious Italian beyond Spaghetti and Meatballs. We had a Baked Rigatoni with Chicken Meatballs but the cream sauce is what sets this off as the ground up salami makes it stand out. You may want to lick the casserole dish! The procuitto and artichoke pizza is delicious as it looks in the picture. The freshly made crushed tomato sauce, a nice crunch crust that holds up the toppings, and a fresh mozzarella that brings it all together! Go to Mucci's and enjoy as those ladies in the kitchen are on fire!

Absolutely amazing! A total surprise! Drove past its unassuming exterior and was blown away with the amazing quality. Great atmosphere, amazing food, very appropriately priced! I will definitely be back!

I couldn't pronounce anything on the menu, but the food sure was delicious. The fried chicken pizza was delectable. The restaurant is small and clean. The staff was incredibly kind and always ready to help. I enjoyed my time there.

AMAZING FOOD!! My partner and I have been a few times and the food is always incredible! The rotating menu keeps things fresh and the staff are on point with their recommendations. Smaller, cozy atmosphere and attention to detail, would suggest to anyone looking for a new date-night experience or a nicer dinner with family.

What more can I say other than... AMAZING. The Bryant/Lake corner curse has finally been lifted and we can all enjoy some of the best pizza, cocktails and SERVICE Minneapolis has to offer. The Calzone Pizza was life changing and their espresso martini will keep me coming back for more. 5 stars!

name: Revival
address: 525 Selby Ave, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
This was a transcendent experience. I cannot describe what it was like to bring this chicken home to a place where my wife and I (who are solid cooks) eat and sleep. I have never experienced something to this level. I was transported to a world of spicy and sweet chicken I have never been. I've eaten in the restaurant more than 5 times but bringing the chicken to a place that hasn't been consecrated is a monumental moment in my life.

This place makes it happen.

Thank you, Revival. I am forever in your debt.

Great southern style place and maybe the best fried chicken in the twin cities. Got the whole bird with "poultrygeist" ghost pepper sauce and another tamer seasoned whole bird. The chicken was still juicy and flavourful under the spicy, crunchy, well sauced skin. And yes, we ate it all. The heat wasn't too bad. 

The sides are delicious as well and really feels like southern food. The hush puppies are a very generous serving for a side. Really enjoyed the mashed potatoes here as well. Might as well get all the sides honestly. The burger cannot be cooked to order. It's similar to Culver's butter burger, where it's a very thin, greasy, yet tasty burger.

Would recommend if you enjoy southern food or friend chicken. A bit pricey, but fair. The cost feels worth the visit.

It's tough to find good Southern cooking this far into the Icy North. Revival stands as an exception to this statement.
Their small menu is packed full of flavorful, delicious delights. Their fried chicken is exemplary, and their other menu items are equally satisfying.
The wait staff is courteous and swift, and the atmosphere is pleasant, if not especially exciting.
Given the quality of the food, the prices are appropriate, though having to order sides a la carte was a bit odd feeling, though understandable given the portion sizes at work.

We've been here and the location in Minneapolis several times. Food is always great. Tennessee Hot chicken is addictive. Southern fried also good. Either way, best fried chicken  in the Twin Cities. Barbecue excellent. Sides vary by location, but also good.

If you want the BEST…. I mean BEST BBQ sauce in the entire world, you MUST come here. They have this orange brown sauce that he said was habanero, but it is NOT at all as spicy as it sounds. When the sauce hits your tongue its like a tingly little sweet spicy feeling, not just taste, this sauce has a feeling. And it’s crazy GOOD! Our ribs were some of the best ribs I’ve ever had! If you’re not used to smoked ribs, the meat is a little tough compared to ribs that just fall off the bone. But with the sauce these ribs were to die for. I had so many endorphins running through my body after eating this. The fried chicken though, that had to be the best I’ve ever had in my life. The skin was crispy and melt in your mouth at the same time. I also love how they are very environmental friendly. No plastic straws, no paper napkins, even no paper towels in the bathroom! We will definitely be coming back!! I give it a 7 out of 10 for sure. 

SAUCE 10/10
RIBS 6/10
CHICKEN 9/10
MAC & CHEESE 8/10
VALUE 7/10
ATMOSPHERE 6/10 *just a little loud
LOCATION 6/10 *limited parking

name: Grand Catch
address: 1672 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: Unique Cajun seafood joint with great cocktails and cozy atmosphere. Their brunch is also one of the best in town. A neighborhood favorite!

Delicious and authentic seafood! The decor and vibe feel effervescent and inviting. Definitely a more pricey place, but you get what you pay for in terms of good-quality seafood. The hostess and waitress were both very friendly and accommodating. Would recommend for a nice night out!

Family took me to Grand Catch for my birthday. Had a great 1st experience. Everyone we met were friendly and follow through with information pertinent to our experience. 

Ordered the El Grand Catch, the Little catch, 3 lbs of head shrimp and two lbs of crawfish. My wife was allergic to shell seafood so she had fries and a fish sandwich.  Food came out in no time! Everything tasted grand! Sauce were on point. 

There were 7 of us so we made a reservation. We got there 10 minutes late but they had our table ready for us and we didn’t have to wait. Perfect place for twosomes or small groups. Make sure to reserve if you have large group. Parking was a challenge but we parked at the middle school after hours.

Would definitely go back & you need to go if you haven’t been there!

So good!! We shared the jumbo shrimp boil and crab Benedict. I was so excited I forgot to take pictures! Can't wait to come back. If you like spice, I recommend the awesome blend at medium or high spice level. 😋😋😋

We love coming here. If you like seafood and Louisiana style spice,  come check it out. The shrimp is my favorite but the crab is great too. Now that I know how delicious their cheesy grits are,  I'll be back more often!

name: Cossetta
address: 211 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: I love their market.  It is the place to go for authentic Italian ingredients.  I love their frozen pastas.  You can just quickly make a sauce, heat the pasta up and have a delicious and easy meal.

There is a cafeteria style eating area, a more upscale seated eating area and an Italian grocery store.   We ate in the cafeteria style section.   The food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  They sell some of their noodle dishes and sauces in the grocery store.  There were a lot of customers so this must be a very popular restaurant.   I liked the store inside the building but it would have been nice if prices were posted.   I probably would have purchased a few items.  I highly recommend this place!

One of my favorite restaurants in Minnesota. The entire restaurant/shop is full of character with lots of features including an espresso bar/bakery, a separate shop for traditional Italian Groceries, and the main restaurant. At less than $20 for a large pizza it is an affordable price, but don't think the quality is cheap. Cosettas has the best most delectable and delicious pizza in the entire state of Minnesota.

I tried this on the advice of a co-worker and it's so much better than I expected. They have so many of the staples of a great Italian market and so much more. Everything is fresh and done with love. They also have a wonderful restaurant and bakery. I wasn't expecting all of that but I loved it.

Been going to the market 3 stores ago. The third store I went to was on the corner down by the river. Was no bigger than the size of a bedroom. I was 4 or 5 years old . I danced for them in the festival of nation's at 8 years old. Been my family restaurant since I was a child. Love that place. Great hard working Staff. Enjoy people.

name: Handsome Hog
address: 203 6th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: Spencer was the best!! Imagine a drink? He made it. They have 25+ bitters to play with. He'll find your pref faster than you.

I have visited the Handsome Hog on several occasions, and each time I have been more and more impressed with the restaurant.

Right from the start, I have always been greeted and seated quickly by very polite and kind staff member; the attitude feels as if I am being welcomed by a friend in the South to their home. This service always continues to the last goodbye, and I appreciate that more than can be expressed here.

The food is top notch, from the menu (which is direct and reflects a restaurant that knows what it's strengths are and does them well, while at the same time always presenting a conundrum in that it all looks SO GOOD.) I always find what I need though... 😊

Once the food has arrived, the experience goes South... In the best way possible. Each bite is filled with flavor and texture and on my goodness I am hungry now thinking about it. I am not paid for this or getting anything in return, I swear, it is just THAT good.

If you are in or will be in Lowertown and would like to enjoy a delicious meal in a cozy, homey setting, this is the place. Go. Now. 😁

Great food, nice atmosphere. I had the Brisket Hash and it was absolutely amazing: very flavorful and tasty. I also had the Bourbon Bloody (Sunday Brunch) which came with a rib on the rim (!) and a Surly beer on the side, and it was awesome! Totally recommended, will definitely be back!
I frequent this place as I enjoy the special atmosphere and the top notch services. The staff is extra efficient and attentive. Fair prices too. Super!

Handsome Hog is an awesome place to eat. I was impressed with the space, service and of course the food. I had the brisket sandwich, mac & cheese and chicken fried pork loin. Both were delicious. I'd definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area.

name: Ghebre's Restaurant
address: 512 Snelling Ave, St Paul, MN 55104, USA
reviews: I dine in this lovely spot quite often! This is my favorite place to dine.  I visit this spot at least once a month. The food is fantastic, the crew is welcoming and the rates are affordable. I like meeting in this place over a tasty dinner.
Delicious! Stopped in for the buffet before a soccer game... such amazing food! Seriously recommend it.
Tasty, affordable locally owned dining.
This is one of my favorite restaurants around. Wonderful, friendly staff who make you feel welcome. The food is amazing

Tried this place on a whim and was blown away with just how delicious the food was. The beef was cooked to perfection, not a single kernel of rice was overcooked, even the cabbage was scrumptious. The portions are large to boot. Friendly service and a warm, humble environment topped off the wonderful experience.

name: Holman's Table
address: 644 Bayfield St, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews: One of the few spots I can give a 5 star review to. We had a nice helicopter ride before dinner. We had a nice view when we sat down for dinner. The food was fantastic. It's very hard to describe. The best way I can put it was that each bite was the same, consistent bites with perfect seasoning, perfect portions. One of the best places I've been to in a long time. The crusted elk was amazing. I will go back without a doubt not just for the amazing view but for the amazing food and service.

I agree that this place is a hidden gem. Seeing the building for the first time was a pleasant surprise. It sure didn't look like an airport building. Bailey was an excellent waitress. We could ask ask for more. The food was pleasantly presented and especially tasty. Most breakfast foods seem very bland to me but this one had unique and interesting flavors. I look forward to going again. We all cleaned our plates.

My husband and I chose Holman's Table to host a champagne toast for our wedding party before our wedding reception at Harriet Island Pavilion. It was the perfect location, and had the most relaxing environment and beautiful ambiance. Kathy and staff worked all the details out seamlessly, kindly served us quickly, and even allowed us to take sparkler pictures out on the front steps. We are so grateful that Holman's Table made our big day so special!

Short; Great service and food. Hands down a hidden gem.
Long; Building itself is really neat. Old terminal. Holman's Table looks right out to the runways and airfield. Ramps next to the building allow for easy parking of aircraft. Also a nice patio for sunny days. 
Staff was friendly and polite. From start to finish the service was on par.
Food was prepared and presented very well. Good mixed drink selection, my wife really enjoyed her mojito. The meals were well put together, presented nicely, and cooked to perfection.
Short ribs just fall apart. And the Amish chicken was perfectly cooked and buttery. Deserts again, well presented and flavorful.
Will be stopping by again soon.

Holman's table is a unique restaurant, located in a wing of the still active control tower of the old St. Paul airport. A very nice location, with knowledgeable and friendly staff and a small but nice menu that feels both homey and classy. From the lunch menu I had eggs with corned beef hash. Totally home made, including the corned beef, with a very good mix in the chunky hash. I chose a side of French onion soup that was very thick and rich, with melted cheese on top. I understand that they're famous for their Reuben too, with their home made corned beef. Very good desserts too - but not cheap. You can watch planes taking off and landing, or splurge and get a helicopter ride along with a great meal. Have fun!

name: Octo fishbar
address: 289 5th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: My husband and I had an excellent time here. The staff are tremendously hospitable and well trained. The food was fresh and delicious! We love the variety of seafood and how it was prepared. I personally loved the seaweed garnishes, I think they have a big impact to the freshness of the dish and they are delicious! We are really satisfied with our food and the pricing. The weekly special was reasonably priced and offer a great wide range of raw, cooked, and different culture cuisines.

I love this place! I've been a few times now and every time I dine here I get exceptional service and lip-smacking delicious food. Today I sat at the bar for happy hour and did some studying. The bartender was very welcoming and friendly. Food came out quickly. Everything was prepared perfectly, especially the calamari! That green sauce is to die for!!!!! This is quickly becoming one of my go to spots in St. Paul.
Great place. You know its fresh when the menu is small and still varied. Great location. Lunch hour parking is a pain but it's only two.blocks from the light rail.

I went to dinner here on a week night. I had a small plate of chilled scallops which was delicious and a large plate of salmon. The food was so good and the flavors were unique. The atmosphere was really nice too. I ate at the bar and the service was excellent. Would love to go back.

Overall, a good experience. Portions are a bit small for the price but the seafood was good. We ordered the Diamond seafood tower to share, which was all good but seemed pricey ($68) for the little amount of items there were. The lobster roll was pretty good and was more rightfully priced. Service was excellent.

name: The Commodore Bar & Restaurant
address: 79 Western Ave N, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews:
I’ve made a terrible mistake. For the life of me I am not sure why this place was not on my radar sooner, but my wife suggested it for our anniversary dinner. After reviewing the menu and pics we gladly made the reservation. 

I am glad we did as everything from the food to the room to the great service exceeded our expectations. Well done!

Please do start with a fine cocktail and the well curated cheese plate. Then it is off to the meat. Both of our steaks was perfectly done and delicious. Make haste to the Commodore!

A really swanky place, replete with silver-framed mirrored hallways and walls, to a Deco bar that will make you catch your breath. Dine here, lounge here, cocktail here, be seen here...it's a luxurious getaway with that speakeasy feel that gangster-era St. Paul is famous for. Happy hours are best...but an hour is best if you're feeling like sporting for something decadent. Casual, dress-up, or just hanging with your friends, you'll find the Commodore more than a little welcoming.

The staff, atmosphere and food here are outstanding. Possibly the best New York strip steak we've ever had (and we've had a lot!) And the smoked butter and Parker rolls were heavenly.
Also it was very clean and well kept, with a special space set up for the social conditions needed right now. I felt like we were in good hands. A++

I'll break down my experience/observations here: 

 - Atmosphere: Beautiful Art-Deco inspired place - very ritzy interior with jazz music played throughout. 
- Dress Code: I recommend at least smart-casual. 
- Cocktails: The cocktails are top notch. I had two drinks: an Old-Fashioned, and their signature cocktail, "The Commodore". Both were excellent. 
- Food: Their menu is rather limited and a tad overpriced, through the food itself was prepared and presented well. 

I would have given 5 stars, but I waited for 30 mins to get seated for my 7:15 reservation, which was made days in advance. No other knocks otherwise.

Wow! Like stepping into an elegant dream. I don't normally like lobster, but I could down those lobster deviled eggs all day! Be sure to order a Fitzgerald and plan on spending some time here just taking it all in.

name: Afro Deli & Grill: St. Paul
address: 5 W 7th Pl, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
