reviews: First and foremost great customer service. The food is fresh and hot and come out relatively fast. We had the lamb gyro and chapati wrap and can not recommend them enough. The fries were seasoned and hot of the fryer. Decent amount of seating and they deliver through third party apps as well. Great for a quick lunch or a bite to eat while in downtown St. Paul.

This has been a go to for a number of years. And for good reason. In the same they have also grown to have another location if I'm not mistaken. Gave this 4 stars instead of 5 because recently the food tastes like it's being less focused on. Hands down though, fries are the best in town. How do you make fries so delicious!?!? Owner is a great person and staff is nice

Parking might be tricky.
Their food has wonderful flavors. Chicken Fantastic. Samosas- beware their accompanying "sauce" or chutney is very spicy but it serves as a palette cleanser. Their food is authentic and delicious.

Don't forget to try their Spiced tea!!

This spot is the one I always prefer. I go to many restaurants but to this place I  constantly return again and again. The team is very welcoming and the food they offer is so flavorful. I never miss an opportunity to have a decent meal in this place. Highly recommended.
Love this place! Really good food. The Somali spice tea is very good too. Staffs are nice as well.

name: Gray Duck Tavern
address: 345 Wabasha St N, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: I was intrigued by the menu so we decided to check this place out before heading to a show at the Amsterdam Bar. We sat at the bar. I ordered a Minnesota Mule which was not on the menu but the bartender whipped up his own house recipe! We also tried the Old Fashioned and the Ranch Hand (woo-wee, spicy, spicy!) . We ordered the Impossible Burger, Rosemary fries and cheese curds. All of which were pretty good. 4 stars for the cheese curds served with honey AND a house ranch sauce! At first glance this place may seem a little pretentious but trust me, it settles. And one tip: stick to a 2 drink minimum. Those spirits are potent! I'm sure we'll wander back in again at some point!

We dined here only because it was close to our hotel and it looked interesting when searching online. We were so impressed we made dinner reservations for the very next evening as well.

The Tamarind Chili wings might be the best wings I have ever had. Asian inspired flavours with citrus and a really good kick to finish it off. Absolutely done to perfection.

The Singapore Broil was prepared exceptionally well. Tender and full of flavour we paired ours with cheesy garlic mashed potatoes and the green beans. The small plate was more than enough for two, with sides.

The gin and tonic is made with in house tonic. My wife loves Gin and tonic and promises it it absolutely worth it (I am not a fan of Gin). The tonic is made with a hint of lime and it has been perfected.

The Old Fashioned is done really well. A twist on this cocktail being made with whiskey but the flavour is excellent and the duck ice puts the presentation over the top. I enjoyed two of them during dinner.

Great food and great location right in the heart of downtown St. Paul.

Stopped by here with my boo for a cocktail after wandering the Winter Carnival.

The kitchen had just closed at ~10, which was fine since we weren't looking for food. The place was JUMPING with people. We sat at the bar, and the bartenders provided pretty quick service (greet, make drinks, get tab) in spite of the crowd. Not the friendliest service, but that can't be held against anyone because - and I can't overstate this - the tavern was super busy.

We each got a signature cocktail, and we both enjoyed our drinks. Atmosphere was young people, like 21-24. My guy and I aren't that much older, but weren't huge fans of the college-kids-being-"classy" vibe from the other patrons.

But drinks were good and staff was efficient.

They had great cocktails! I'm vegan, so for dinner I got the Impossible Burger with no cheese and no bun. My burger came wrapped  in a lettuce bun which was fantastic and thoughtful. I did the green beans as a side order. My husband got the prime rib, and said everything was perfect. We will for sure be back again, and love to see a place that can accommodate different dietary restrictions!

I visit this lovely place  a lot! This is my favorite spot to grab a bite.  I go there routinely. The cooking is great, the team is helpful and the prices are decent. I enjoy going in this restaurant for a good meal.

name: Dark Horse Bar & Eatery
address: 250 E 7th St, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews:
Amazed by the late night happy hour, 11p-2am! Food was so tasty! Service was great! 
Cute and elegant atmosphere!

Very good pizza and plenty of tap beers that go well with it. The staff is courteous an always polite. The menu has some very good selections and the kitchen is open until closing. 🍷"Dig in and meet a new friend" at the Dark 🐎Horse! 🍻

Monday Night at the Dark Horse includes a two topping pizza and a bottle of wine for $25. You can't beat that. The pizza was amazingly delicious. This was our second time coming here and we will be going back alot more. Great atmosphere and the service is the best I've had so far.
Delicious happy hour menu. Christina was quick and attentive. The fries are spectacular!!
We ended up here when plans at another restaurant fell through.   And it was wonderful.  Our food was great, as was the beer selection.   The service was top notch too.

name: Bar Brigade
address: 470 Cleveland Ave S, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: Great people take care of you here at Bar Brigade. Everything is made in house. Coffee anyway you like. I prefer the creme with coffee haha ;) it feels pleasant and warm even in Winter.

Last week was the first time in this good restaurant. But It is definitely not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the generous service, with the finest  cuisine and fine drinks and with the decent charge. We will definitely return there in a short time.

I had the wild boar bourguignon

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Fork tender!

The wait staff was super friendly and very knowledgeable about what they would recommend.

For sure will be going back!

A small restaurant, big on taste!

One of our favorite places in St. Paul. Of you co sider yourself a "foodie", you must stop here. Fine dining at an affordable price nestled in a neighborhood. There is a very unassuming sign in front, which does not hint at the fabulous experience you will have inside. There is street parking, but, it has never been an issue for us.

Great little French restaurant! The atmosphere was intimate and cozy. Our service was great. We started with a goat cheese small plate, had lobster crepes and smoked trout for entrees, and the vanilla pot de creme for dessert. The app and entrees were DELICIOUS. The pot de creme was fine but I wouldn't order it again (Bar Brigade, please replace this dessert item with something else that stands up to the rest of the incredible food we had last night). I'm still giving 5 stars because overall, our experience was fantastic.Definitely coming again!

name: Babani's Kurdish Restaurant
address: 32 E Fillmore Ave, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews: I go with my wife to this great restaurant quite often! This is my favorite restaurant to to have a good dinner.  I go to this spot at least once a month. The food is very tasty, the team is helpful and the price is decent. I enjoy eating in this place over a tasty dinner.
Very friendly.  Quick service.  Amazing food!

I'm always up for something different and have sampled food from all parts of the world. My roommate and I had an early dinner here and weren't too enthused. I tried a lemon flavored soup that was a bit too much for me. Our main courses were good but didn't have a kick, they were "safe". I asked for hot sauce or something to give it a lift but they didn't have anything. The place is cute abd clean and our server was good.
Fabulous food. Fast service. Competent staff. Reasonable prices. Great location. Definitely a place to go.
Awesome place, great food

name: Stewart's
address: 128 Cleveland Ave N, St Paul, MN 55104, USA
reviews: It’s difficult to place what kind of food Stewart’s is because there’s quite a variety. Some Asian, traditional American, and some Jamaican. Small little place under an apartment building, but super cute. The waitstaff was quick and polite. All the food was fresh and delicious. Personal favorite was the cauliflower gratin.
A cozy little place with great food and great service. I would highly recommend getting the buffalo brussel sprouts. I also got the southwest chicken breast. This is an ideal spot for a date night.

This place is so wonderful.  I'm hesitant to share because I think it may be a secret love for regulars. We enjoyed a pork shank that evoked warm family nostalgia, buffalo style Brussels, tender Korean fried chicken and savory mussels.

In love with this restaurant. I've driven by it so many times but never realized how nice it was inside and that they had such good and unique food! We started with one of the favorites of the restaurant, the Buffalo Brussels Sprouts. These are a must. If you don't like veggies or greens, these will change your life. We also shared the walleye dinner and a special of the night, a type of tostada with crab, radishes, and avo spread. We also had their margarita drink which had a kick to it and was strong!  One of my new favorite places in St Paul.

Nice ambiance and based on other reviews I read up on here, I had high hopes that the food would be on point -- disappointingly, the items we ordered we ordered were just "meh". 

Korean Fries: Wasn't horrible but nothing to be excited about either. The dips were just ok as well. Overall, the fries would've tasted better if they didn't saturate it with sodium & spices. 2/5 Stars.

Szechuan Noodles: This was utter misery! A bad attempt to fuse kimchi with some undercooked noodles, shiitake mushrooms & leathery tofu that simply didn't mesh!!! The tangy-acidity of either the kimchi or the sauce that they used was overpowering, leaving no room for any other flavors. 0/5 Stars.

Pork Cheeks: Pork was really tender with jalapeno grits which add a unique twist of flavor & texture. The pork cuts though tender, were a tad too salty for my taste. Ease up on the salt and this may have earned 4 stars.  3/5 Stars

Winter Spiced Bread Pudding: The best item out of the lot. Pudding bread topped with butterscotch sauce, spices and crunchy, candied almond clusters. 4/5 Stars 

Would I go again? Likely not. Or if I ever did, I would very much make sure not to order any of the above items again except for the Spiced Bread Pudding.

name: Yarusso Bros Italian Restaurant
address: 635 Payne Ave, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews: My husband and I decided to go out for my birthday and he wanted to take me somewhere slightly outside of the city. This little patch of heaven, located in a small neighborhood, was well worth the drive. The pictures do not accurately depict how massive these plates are. The food is fantastic, the service is incredible and the amount for cost is jaw dropping. The price on the menu that you see is well worth it. I highly recommend this place and will be bringing everyone I know to this historic restaurant.

Yarusso brothers is a gem! Freddy Yarusso, the last remaining brother has carried on the tradition and friendliness of this restaurant. It is located on the east side of St. Paul, just down the street from the old Hamms brewery and it is a place not to miss. The red sauce is amazing and the portions are very good so you will not be disappointed. When you walk in you feel like you are travelling back in time, like you are in a movie or something. And maybe it's because he has The Godfather playing constantly. If you are in the area and are hungry for some good Italian, check this place out!

We enjoy to go out. Last night we  visited this superb restaurant which friends recommended to us. We passed a delightful experience there with superb meal and a well-trained crew and a talented  cuisine. We  added this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we shall definitely come back very soon. We warmly recommend.

Great Italian restaurant.  Kids eat free on Sundays.

Try the "Sloppy Dago with Cheese".  The fried ravioli are amazing for an appetizer.

two days ago was our first time we visited this good restaurant. But It is absolutely not the last time. We enjoyed the evening a lot with the good service, with the high quality  cuisine and fine drinks and with the friendly pay. We will absolutely come back in a short time.

name: PUBLIC kitchen + bar
address: 229 6th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: very quiet evening,a well dress friendly male host greet us as soon as we open the door. Very pretty roomy restaurant would be good for party. The spicy salsa under the grilled are delicious with seafoods. Steaks are medium well as what they respected. Dessert just alright through.

The food was good.  A few items great.  Cacio E Pepe was terrific, the asparagus was wonderful.  The blueberry sauces on desserts were extremely flavorful.  Unfortunately the kitchen was amazingly slow, despite the dining room being quite not full.  One meal, lobster mac and cheese was straight up cold.  And two meals came out 5+ minutes later than the others, after already experiencing a long wait.  It would have been okay if it was just adults, but we had kids and the extra 20+ minutes just didn't work.  Appetizer menu sounded great, but the prices scared us off.  The drink menu was good, decent array of great craft beer.  There were odd things no longer available though, both on the food and beverage menus.  I'm open to try again, but if the kitchen is that slow again...
Great vibes and super welcoming service. The food was crisp and yummy. Will easily recommend this place to others. Fair rates and generous portions. Keep it up.
Clean. Nice decor. Great service. Delicious food. Awesome atmosphere. Wonderful time.  Oh and bottomless mimosas at brunch on weekends. How could you not love this place. Can’t wait to go back 🤗

First and foremost they seated us 30 minutes early because my girlfriend and I showed up much earlier than the rest of our group which was great. Then they let us order our bottomless mimosas early so we got to drink while we waited for the rest of our group! The atmosphere was very calming and it gave off a comforting vibe. The food was really good to! Our mimosas came in wine glasses so they were big!! Never once finished my mimosa before they refilled it which was wonderful!
The only complaint I had was they seem to put a big char on all their steaks. The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare) in the middle but the outside of all our steaks were charred a bit too much for our preference. Besides that everything was delicious!

name: Agelgil Ethiopian Restaurant (St. Paul, MN)
address: 2585 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55116, USA
reviews: I come to this special place every couple of days  as I love the good mood that is exist in this restaurant. The staff is exceptionally loyal and experienced. The service is deeply efficient. Not to mention, the food you eat is highly distinguished. I ate there many times and I was always delighted. The expense is modest. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends.

I ordered takeout for myself - beef and veggie.  This included a bunch of different dishes that were all fantastic.  My meal stretched into 3 - so much food! Lovely lady took my order and credit card over the phone and they brought it to my car outside when I called to say I had arrived.
Great food. The atmosphere is cater more towards adult only. I had two young children with me. The service was nice.

You guys gotta be struggling. How is your rice dry and food barely seasoned?!? All you hear while sitting in the restaurant is the taxi men getting drunk and shooting pool.  At best you get a 2 out of 5 simply because the only person working the front of the house (waitress/ bartender/ hostess) was a  very pleasant lady.

I went here a while ago, and I really needed to think about how i feel about the place. My overall consensus is that it is awesome. The lovely waitress who didn't understand what we were doing there was so kind. Someone I was with wanted a side order of cottage cheese" eww idk why" . But to make sure that it would be like the waitress brought a small sample of it to try so we didn't waste our money which I really appreciated.  We got this dish the was like a Bready, meaty, and peppery mixture. Inside the mixture had cut up pieces of the same bread meant to consume the dish with. Very good, huge portions. Total bill was like 13 bucks and this plate could feed 3-5 people. We got #26/27.

name: Herbie's On The Park
address: 317 Washington St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Very nice restaurant to visit after going to the River Center. This place had a nice environment and some hockey stuff on display. The service was a little slow but the food was great. I definitely recommend this place. The pretzel appetizer was fantastic and so was my cobb salad.

I’ve seen some reviews stating that service is slow or nonexistent. I did not see this. We were in last  Saturday before a MN Wild game. We were greeted immediately and at. We were also brought water and our beverage orders were taken. The place was increasingly busy and soon the bar area was packed. We never felt neglected and our server was attentive.

The food was very good. We had the brussel sprouts, scallop pasta, risotto and flat bread pizza. All were very tasty. Our cocktails were also very tasty, but not very strong. We’d definitely come back. We had great service, great food and decent drinks. The atmosphere is really nice with the fireplace.
Food is good, more-so gourmet with a limited 1-page pricey menu, but you pay for location.  Atmosphere is casual.  Service during our visit wasn’t up to par. Not going back.
Went here during lunchtime on a Sunday and had to order from the brunch menu. Food was okay, just very limited choices. Server was excellent and very nice ambience!

To be honest I haven't tried their food. This is my after Wild game stop. They make great old fashions if you're interested. I always request the girl in the gold rim glasses as she is very attention oriented server.

name: Caffe Biaggio
address: 2356 University Ave W, St Paul, MN 55114, USA
reviews:
WOW!!!  I'm not a big Valentine's date night kind of guy, but Caffe Biaggio may have changed that for good.  Their special Valentine's Day seating last night was TOTALLY AWESOME!  

We try to dine at Caffe Biaggio a couple times a year and should be going a lot more often.  They are the very BEST Italian restaurant in the Twin Cities.  Last nights seating included 3 great entrees . . . Steak and Lobster,  Salmon and one of their signature regular menu items Gnocchi in red sauce.  3 of the 4 of us each had a different entree and they were all perfectly done. The appetizer, salad and dessert were also perfect and delicious.

Service at Caffe Biaggio is always top notch and last night was no different.  

Caffe Biaggio continues to be a gem.  I would recommend it to everyone.  For groups, for special occasions and especially for date night.  If you haven't been, and you consider yourself a foodie, you've missed out on one of the best experiences in the Twin Cities!  Go!
First time. Linguine with shrimp in a light lemon cream sauce. Delicious! Good ratio of shrimp to broccoli to pasta. One recommendation, less onion and more lemon.

We met with friends at this place for a meeting. we heard about this spot from a lot of people.  Well, it was a winning. the staff members were so friendly and we had an excellent feeling. The food was just great. We loved this spot a lot and we will visit this place again. Highly recommended.

I give this establishment a three stars. This is a beautiful establishment. The ambience and feel is delightful. The service was great. The waiter who served me was very friendly and professional. The only thing that stops me from giving this establishment a four or five is the food. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were slightly dry and the sauce was watery. The meatballs had a great kick to it but it was ruined by the dryness of the meatballs. Also, the watery sauce lowered the quality of the dish. My dish was a letdown after the great service and atmosphere.
What great ambiance at this place. Tim was our server and he was very helpful with suggesting dishes. I had lobster risotto and it was great.

name: Osteria I Nonni
address: 981 Sibley Memorial Hwy, St Paul, MN 55118, USA
reviews:
It’s a mediocre restaurant with average quality food.They do not bake their bread,instead a cheap supermarket version is served.
Dishes are nothing to remember.
If table is booked in advance they can find a good one.We did so and our seats were very nice.
We do not recommend to dine there for any special occasion like birthday or New Year’s Eve one - there is no ambience,no music.The interior is ordinary,dull and boring.
We would recommend the owner to travel abroad and learn how to make a restaurant truly Italian.

Top notch Italian Restaurant in MSP.  They have plenty of vegetarian options which made me feel at home. Their deserts are drool worthy and you are bound to have withdrawal symptoms long after your dinner.
I get to eat here a lot since I work in the area. I must say their customer service is always good and they keep the spot neat constantly. Prices are convenient and they serve big portions.

A fine dining Italian restaurant, not family style like Bucas, is a great experience. We spent alittle over two hours here enjoying the food and friendly staff. The courses are separated by classic Italian courses, however, are not meant to be a four course dinner. Each dish is a sufficient meal. The portions are typical fine dining portions. The cooking here was great, very few cooking errors or mistakes. In a party of six, everyone enjoyed their food and atmosphere. The lighting can be considered alittle dark at night. Definitely worth a revisit and would recommend the gnocchi.
Fantastic food, very warm atmosphere and excellent service. This is s great date night spot. A hidden gem?!?

name: Hyacinth
address: 790 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: This is a very cute bistro style restaurant. We made reservations last minute and were able to do an early dinner. Service was attentive without hovering—we each had a pasta and shared the snap pea and burrata salad. The salad was amazing, really light yet well seasoned. The pastas were both good—very much a homemade feel. They were good but not great, but I’d like to return and try out some of their entrees. Considering the tip is factored into the prices, the prices are pretty fair here. Finally, I should mention the decor is wonderful, really simple but cute. Would definitely visit again!

Cozy casual atmosphere with great food!! Meatball was amazing 🤤 Recommend making a reservation from their website. Good place for a date - nice but not fancy. Prices are reasonable considering they include gratuity.

Superb service, lovely atmosphere, and one of the best meals I've had in the Twin Cities. Every dish we had was amazing - the celery salad (one of the most unique and refreshing salads, even for my husband who doesn't eat salad often) the bucatini (totally worth the hype from the Star Tribune), the risotto (unique in many ways, flavors off the chart), and a chocolate mouse desert. Everything was perfect. I want to go back asap to try everything else! Also appreciate that they include gratuity in the cost of the dinner.

I've been meaning to try Hyacinth for some time now and I'm glad I did. It's a small restaurant, small menu and small plates. We liked everything we tried but nothing stood out as the best dish of the night. I'll be excited to come back when they change their menu in the future.

This is a truly great restaurant. Everything we had was great. The pasta is seasoned and cooked perfectly and the service was excellent. This is a Bachelor Farmer level of food and service imo. It's pricey but worth it for a special occasion.

name: Magnolias Restaurant
address: 1081 Payne Ave, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews: The steak was nice and simple - just salt and pepper and cooked to perfection. This steak was just cooked so well! So if you're looking for just a nice piece of steak without the chef trying to be complicated with all that extra flavor and spice, this is it! Prices are great and diner has an 80's feel/atmosphere to it.
Good home cooking! Small place, but great prices and great food!

I love this place. My favorite neighborhood diner. It's not new or fancy, but it is cozy.  Good food, great prices and friendly staff. Not a ton of seating, so you may have a wait on peak days and hours. My girlfriend and I mainly come for breakfast. Good coffee too. Check it out.
I didn't hate it,  lol. The service and food was fine. Didn't stand out. In their defense the French Toast is awesome!! The rest of the meal was average. Our server was polite and prompt

Everything was alright. It seems like a basic diner. Most of the food is bland and some of it tasted extremely processed. The fish was freshly caught and fried. The seating is outdated and was uncomfortable for the handicapped or overweight in our group.

In response to owner, I mean that is pretty much what I said. A 3 star literally means "It's okay." No one is blaming you for picking a small space for your restaurant, it's just important for some people to know that they may be uncomfortable or in pain before they decide to come there. It's mainly the gravy and soup pictured that tasted processed. Made from scratch can mean a lot of things, but even if it was made from mostly fresh ingredients, those two things didn't taste very good to us. If you hear this from multiple patrons maybe you can know what to tweak. Good fish though!

name: Boca Chica | Restaurante Mexicano & Cantina
address: 11 Cesar Chavez St, St Paul, MN 55107, USA
reviews: Very good authentic and tex mex food - got the opportunity to try the buffet and it did not disappoint. Lots of seating and bar is a good place for lunch. Jose did a great job helping to order and immediately suggested a margarita and a buffet - bother were outstanding. Family owned and you can tell by their level of professionalism and information. Really happy I went and cannot wait to go back!

This place has amazing food and a great selection of it. The complimentary chips and salsa before dinner are some of the best I've had (top 3)! Warning one of the salsas has a little zing to it but the other is spicy not to spicy though (although I love spicy food)! I had the Enchiladas Verde and what can I say, close your eyes picture the best enchiladas Verde and that's what I got.

I celebrated my nomination last night in this delicious restaurant. I am glad to say that it was a marvelous evening and the venue was clearly the reason for this outstanding celebration. The team  cooperated in a very nice way, the cuisine was extremely good and my friends were so  thrilled. We shall definitely return for more celebrations. Thank you very much.

I have only been there for lunch time buffet going on 3 years now. You don't know what your getting everyday on about 1/3 of it.They change it up. Good selection. It's more on the authentic side, and not too spicy unless u make it that way.  Nice place inside, its a quick get in, eat and get back to work thing for me. Good service and nice people. Check it out.

I've been enjoying Boca Chica for more than 30 years. The food is always delicious; the location is inviting and comfortable. Today was no different. I opted for fajitas this afternoon but, if you can go for lunch during the week, I'd recommend the lunch buffet. Their chicken enchiladas are also top notch.

name: M ST. Cafe
address: 350 N Market St, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Always a fantastic buffet on the holidays...cold buffet, soup, breakfast items, chef carved meats station, made-to-order omelette station and large seasonal dessert table...the servers are always pleasant, even though working a holiday, live piano stylings in the background...never a rush to have you leave, so they can reset your table...if you leave hungry, it's your own fault...they can accommodate couples to groups of over twenty, but reservations are a must...I've been doing the special occasion buffets here for several years, my #1 go-to in St. Paul & the East Metro...
Went for Sunday brunch buffet with the friends I invited. We all enjoyed the food. Everything was great. The parking cost was the only downer

Buffets here are always amazing. Different selections, and everything is always spot on. Lots of care is given to every dish. And this does not end up being wedding style food, or food that just sits in pans that gets old. Great buffet experience; we've just never ordered from the menu.
Service is fast and friendly. Tried the northwoods omelet (asparagus, mushrooms, gruyere) and it was great. The hashbrowns it came with were also wonderful. Would recommend.
Great buffet options for going out on Thanksgiving or Christmas.

name: Carmelo's Ristorante
address: 238 Snelling Ave S, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: In my opinion, if an Italian restaurant can't make an awesome plate of spaghetti and meatballs, it's not worth trying anything else on the menu. Well, this is just about the best spaghetti you're going to find anywhere. Homemade noodles, meatballs which hold together well but are still a little bouncy, and sauce so good I'm tempted to request it as a cup of soup. Great job, Carmelo's!

All the soups and bread are homemade and delicious!  My favorite entrees are the Chicken Milanese, spaghetti and meatballs, and ravioli Carmelo. It packs up and travels well, so is great for takeout or delivery. 

Only suggestion, offer desserts for delivery if possible!

Great food great environment. I thought service was a little slow since there was only 1 server so if you're in a rush it's not ideal. But otherwise they're friendly and food taste fresh and authentic. Love it and will come back later
We Love Carmelo’s. Hardest working wait staff, with amazing customer service skills. Quiet, lovely place with Fantastic Food. We are sure lucky Carmelo’s is on the neighborhood. Thank You!!

A white table cloth & candlelit coursed Italian ristorante with gentle, mellow flavored.  I liked the atmosphere and wine list but the food we had tonight needed more flavor...and salt.  I did looking forward to bread with a flavored oil dip but they had pre-packaged butter bars instead, although the bread was super fluffy, soft and delicious with the butter.  The calamari was a little too soft and not crispy enough and didn't taste salted at all... but perhaps the lemon aioli is supposed to make up for it?  A slight disappointment, however, overall, the foods would be good for those who are severely watching their salt intake.  Service was good, friendly and attentive.  
*Shrimp Garlic Aglio Olio, Shrimp Macalester & Calamari appetizer. 
*Drinks: a mixed white comprised of chardonnay, sauvignon blanc, voigner and moscato: less dry with a hint of sweetness but with a nice, lingering taste.  I normally don't like any sweet white but this one was tasty.  And hubby's italian beer: light.

name: Black Sheep Coal Fired Pizza
address: 512 Robert St N, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Great service every time, whether it’s from the servers or the bartenders. Great food every time, too. I’d highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a fun, tasty, and healthier option to traditional pizza. They also now have a full bar. The only flaw is the Sicilian pizza. It’s just an expensive cheese pizza.

We all loved our experience here!  Atmosphere, food, and service were AMAZING!  We each got our own build your own pizza and everyone loved theirs.   Would highly recommend trying this place, plus it’s within walking distance of the Saints ball field...so dinner before the game!!

Wonderful experience every time there. Did the drive up last night, met  Sara the Manager! Her attitude and appreciation for we the customers supporting them during this time was made very evident!! The family will be back as often as possible...hopefully sooner than later.

I feel so bad because I just found out about this place a few months ago, and I had been renting a practice space underneath for the past three years. So far, this is the best pizza I've had in Minnesota (and I eat pizza very regularly). The inside has a cool hipster vibe. Give it a shot you wont be disappointed.

What an absolutely wonderful pizza. I went early on a Saturday evening, so it was pretty busy. In spite of that, we never felt rushed and we never felt ignored. I had the #1, a nice, simple cheese pizza and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The crust had a wonderful crisp to it and the cheese was salty and fresh. My only complaint, and it is a small one, is that the tomato sauce was fairly transparent in flavor. It felt like it massive needed a little more time to simmer, or a little more seasoning, but that is splitting hairs.

Great job Black Sheep! I will be back, and I will be recommending you to my friends.

name: Fasika Restaurant
address: 510 Snelling Ave N, St Paul, MN 55104, USA
reviews: A simple place that caters to a variety of clientele. We tried the vegetarian sampler and it was good.  Saw people there from different ethnic backgrounds enjoying their meals. Also ordered coffee and was not disappointed. Lunch and coffee for 2 for a total of $25.00 including tip.

Being an Indian, I am a big fan of spicy food and Ethiopian food is my new favorite!! I had the veggie sampler and my friend had the chicken. The taste was soooo good and the price is very affordable!!
THE FOOD IS AMAZING!!! Servers need better customer service

Warm greeting from several staff as soon as we entered.  Very nice written welcome from Fasika on Page 1 of the menu. Many entrees to select on the menu and our server helped guide us navigate the options. The combination entrees are very large and can easily serve two people. We had the beef combo and the flavor was excellent! We had to work to finish it all and we did not quite succeed.  The servers are friendly, happy and attentive. The dining room has plenty of space. There was a family with an infant and 3 toddlers across the room and they had plenty of space around a large table. We will definitely be back and we will bring friends with us!  We live in Minnetonka and yes, Fasika’s is worth the drive!

Busy place, slow paced service, but as there is only one server covering everything, that can be forgiven. Food was hot and fresh but my dish limited to just cabbage and grape leaf. I ate at 6pm and many dishes--including coffee--were off the menu. There is another traditional ethnic restaurant one block north with a better space and pricing. I would venture there first before returning to Fasika.

name: Brunson's Pub
address: 956 Payne Ave, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews: I’ve loved Brunson’s Pub for a long time, it’s hard not to. You instantly feel comfortable when you walk into their space and their service is excellent. We’ve always had friendly servers who have great recommendations. Their food is phenomenal... I can’t say enough about the Pulled Bacon BLT (even with needing a gluten free bun). What motivated me to leave a review now is their exceptional service during the Stay at Home orders. It was easy to place our order over the phone and they were outside within seconds of pulling into the parking lot. The food was well packaged, and was still hot by the time we got home. I miss going out to restaurants but this was such a great experience tonight that I appreciate Brunson’s on a whole new level. Thank you for making our night!

Fantastic service! Great cheese curds, the honey and balsamic aioli dips sound like a weird combo, but they work somehow- and it's delicious. I got the #No Payne no gain burger and my husband got the Reuben burger, both were great.

Great food and good service.  We tried a few of their burgers and all were good.  I wasn't too sure when I saw that their "wings" were thighs, but it was great.  Cooked perfectly! And they were nice and crunchy with the dry rub.  They had a great beer list and happy hour specials too.  Will definitely return.
Amazing food and even better people. We love stopping by here for apps, dinner, or even a few drinks. The staff is always tentative and very nice. Making this a usual neighborhood spot for us!

Soooo, we knew we were full, but we just kept eating, and eating. Now we are one wafer thin mint away... We always split the curds. Tonight we were craving their fish and chips.  Stellar. Their serving size is plenty, so we decided to split the fish and a berry salad.  Should not have gotten the full size salad. Is pretty busy,  so relax knowing you will probably wait a bit.  SUPER nice staff.

name: The Lexington
address: 1096 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: This is an old school bar and restaurant. Think leather easy chairs, soft lighting, tons of rooms and a jazz combo on the weekend. There are two different bars and a specific bar menu, though the full menu is available at the bar also. Tiny parking lot, valet is available. We've been twice and had an amazingly delicious dinner as well as a great night with friends in the bar. Attracts an older crowd, dress is everything from dressy to track suits. Given the prices, I'd dress up a bit. Drinks are strong and the bar food is good for a group. Only complaint is that we got a very loud table next to the bar even after making a reservation. Lots of room for big dinner groups.
Food was great but the service was amazing. Chef went out of his way and made us steak sandwiches from left overs. Out of town guest and would highly recommend.

I just love this place! The ambience is great, and I have had great service every time I've been there. All the employees really seem to enjoy working there. I've only come in for drinks and usually enjoy being belly up and people watching.  Such a diverse crowd. Very classy place, and one of my new favorite spots in St Paul. I'll definitely be back soon!

Another delightful dinner on a very busy Valentine’s Day evening. Food was outstanding. Service was impeccable. The owner is always around to make sure things are right. Definitely worth treating yourself once in awhile. A tip, for a quiet evening ask to reserve a table in the dining room and not the bar. The bar is a fun atmosphere but quite loud.
Expensive but excellent. We really liked the sriracha deviled egg and their burger is excellent. We like to sit at the bar and watch the food go by while we eat and imbibe the cocktails.

name: The Bulldog Lowertown
address: 237 6th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews: We visited here twice on weekend of 8/9/19.  Once on a Friday and on a Sunday.   I can say on a Sunday, best place to go downtown.  We went through several different places, and this one was the place to be.   We enjoyed to food, atmosphere and wait staff.

I stopped at the restaurant on my way to a Saint's baseball game ... Such a nice place and atmosphere. The service was excellent and we were a big party. The menu has great selections; try the spicy hamburgers; that is if you enjoy spicy food. The restaurant has outdoor seating.

We went here for my best friends birthday. A group of 11 happy celebratory girls. 10 minutes in we were all shushed from the bartender for being too loud. Needless to say it ruined the happy mood and we got our tab and left immediately to Barrio next door. We were happy to take our money elsewhere and not get scolded for having a great time. Didn’t realize The Bulldog was a retirement home.
The cheese curds were excellent. Our waitress was great. They have a great selection of craft beers.  Just wasn't impressed with the actual entrees.

I love their philly cheese steaks, the best in the twin cities. Very cozy atmosphere and always a good time to bring a date or have some fun with the girls at the bar. When it’s nice out it’s a very cute place to take a romantic walk after in the little park across the street.

name: Bennett's Chop & Railhouse
address: 1305 7th St W, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: Waitress was really nice. The avocado crab bread was delicious. My tomahawk steak med/rare was dry with no flavor. Didn't really seem like it was a 20oz. Maybe a 16oz. Usually when i eat steak i don't really use A1 but i had to because lack of flavor and dryness. The loaded potato only had cream and like 4 specks of bacon. My lady got the trio medallion she said hers tasted dry right away. The salad was so small and plain. Maybe try the ribs or pasta if i ever go again. Definitely not a place i would get a steak again.  Ordered a Purple Rain. It was really sweet but barely alcohol didn't even catch a buzz and i only drink like once a month. I gave the three stars because the waitress was really nice.
Very tasty food but most definitely not the place to go on a budget. The free shuttle to the Wild game was wonderful! We will definitely be back!

Got there to our 9:15 p.m. reservation for Saint Valentine's Day night with my long dress coat and no coat check. People were hanging their coats on the backs of their chairs. Mine would have been sitting half on the floor. Libby the hostess helped me resolve this by allowing me to hang it at the hostess stand! 🙂 Great cuts of steak! 🥩I had the Tomahawk! It had some fat on it too that I enjoyed with the delicious perfectly cooked meat! My two dogs got a little taste as well!🐺🐶  I picked it as I saw it was one of their specialties.🍸 I was glad their menu labeled things that way. The vegetable was green beans. They were cooked to perfection but there were so few. Molly our waitress immediately noticed this and rectified it! Everything went smoothly until the bartender started playing very unromantic hip hop, I think.🎵 Fortunately, it was towards the end of our meal and Molly, our waitress smoothed things out.😇 Another very helpful and patient waitress took many pictures of my Valentine and me💘 with my confusing camera, to commemorate the evening. Great staff and great chops! Thank you! My date was very pleased with the whole evening!

Great experience.  The staff were fantastic, friendly and fast. The food was excellent. I had an issue with my dish. Not only did they make it right, they comp'd us a desert to boot. Just fantastic all around. Highly recommended. Definitely going back.

Craved a good Steak and they delivered.  The ribeye was juicy and flavorful without the salty/sodium injected taste.  The New York Strip was thick and tasty. The service was perfect, friendly and laid back.

name: Salut Bar Americain
address: 917 Grand Ave, St Paul, MN 55105, USA
reviews: I come here often with my friends for brunch. I love the egg white omelet. It's fluffy, delicious and very filling. The chefs do it right every time! I love the ambience here. Clean, fresh and a great way to start the weekend.

Salut has great service and a big menu that can satisfy anyone. It’s a fancy feeling restaurant with a local flair and the food is consistent and always has been good. The steak sandwich is one of the staples in my opinion but you can’t really go wrong regardless of what you order.

Haven't been  there for years, we just happened to be in the neighborhood,  glad we were, such great ambience,  waiter was very thoughtful, love being able to see into the kitchen. Feel at home. Looking forward to going back. Brunch looks like a good idea! Great cooks, very tasty. Thank you.

First time at this fabulous find for lunch.  Driving down Grand looking for a place to stop we saw the word Salute so decided to take a chance and boy are we glad we did.  Cozy and inviting decor and very friendly staff.  A diverse but not overly large menu had something for everyone in our group. Seafood and chicken crepes and the burger which was one of the best ever plus a lovely bottle of wine made our day.  We will definitely be back and tell others of our find.

Food was outstanding. The quality of the food is five stars and the presentation is also super. Service was very good - even though our server had a large party to take care of in addition to ours, she was on top of everything. The ambiance flexes easily, casual to formal.  And save room for dessert because it's a must!

name: Sakura Restaurant & Bar
address: 350 St Peter St #195, St Paul, MN 55102, USA
reviews: My husband took me here for my birthday last year. It was phenomenal. This is where I go when I want delicious sushi. I can't wait to be able to go in and sit down to eat when Covid-19 is done. For now I satisfy that craving with takeout.

I come to this special place many times because I love the special air that is exist in this place. The team is exceptionally cordial and qualified. The service is extremely rapid. Needless to say, the food they prepare is highly distinguished. I ate there many times and I was always happy. The price is modest. I highly recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.
Great ambiance. Professional service. Price is good. Food is tasty. Came here since it’s close to the courthouse. I would recommend this to family and friends that are into sushi for sure.
We LOVE the sushi at Sakura! The staff is very friendly, and the prices are reasonable. It's a great part of downtown Saint Paul, and I definitely think it is the best sushi in the area.
I like this restaurant a lot. there is a romantic mood. The food is splendid. the service is dynamic and the waiters are trained. The price is satisfactory. I highly recommend.

name: Little Oven
address: 1786 Minnehaha Ave E, St Paul, MN 55119, USA
reviews: This place is amazing. Best Chicken Parm and Lasagna you'll find around. Good prices, portions and quality. Would 100% recommend trying this out no matter how far of a drive it is. (bring cash, they don't take cards) I just ordered two Lasagnas for carry out, they were fantastic. If your tired of sitting at home during this time, go support a local place like this or call someone who will go pick it up for you!

Great place to eat with that family/friendly atmosphere. Food portions are huge and well worth the price. Had the Gondola Boat with fries and a half basket of onion rings. Everything tasted great and fresh. Only downfall is they are cash only. Definitely will be back.

This spot is super chill, and in cut but definitely worth while! They have great portion sizes, and the menu prices are also very reasonable.

The staff seemed nice, and the atmosphere of the place was relaxed, and welcoming...went in for a quick lunch with my coworkers....

I had the Sunnies and Chips which was pretty good even though the fish was a little “fishy” there fries were also on point, and you get a hefty portion of them which is a bonus....only thing that could have made this meal better would have been a nice coleslaw on the side!  

Also the pizza is pretty lit (tasty) Get it well done!

I’ll def check out this spot again to try some more Italian choices from the menu!
A top class restaurant! The standards and quality far surpass the price tag, in all honestly it’s worth way more than what we were charged. All the waitstaff were great!

First time there. Service was great. Not a white table cloth wine list kind of place but good red sauce and meatballs on spaghetti.  Definitely order the bread sticks made from their pizza dough. Awesome!

name: COOK ST PAUL
address: 1124 Payne Ave, St Paul, MN 55130, USA
reviews: This is the best new place I've been to in years. Don't let the location scare you off. In fact, I think it works for them. I had the Bi Bim Bop, one of their specialties. It was fantastic. Just the right spiciness.  Not scorching. Something for everyone. The servers were very welcoming also.

Great breakfast! Their hidden secret in this dish is the fried (to perfection) rice ball under the egg. This was topped off with great service and a coffee level that wasn't allowed to reach the bottom of the mug by our server. Thanks!

We met with friends at this restaurant for dinner. we heard about this restaurant from quite a few people.  Well, we were not disappointed. we were warmly welcomed by the crew  and we had an excellent feeling. The food was just great. We loved this restaurant a lot and we will visit this place again. Highly recommended.
Delicious food. I like the food fusion flavors too! Korean with American dishes in one! Highly recommend

Small, quaint place. Food was different but very good. A little too pricey for me especially for breakfast. I spent $66 before the tip for 3 people's breakfast. Service was super friendly and amazing. If it weren't for the cost, I would go there again.

name: Big River Pizza
address: 280 5th St E, St Paul, MN 55101, USA
reviews:
Lots of great reasons to come here - easy to order, pleasant location, lots of natural light, and plenty of pizza options, including single slices. 
Crust is thin and crunchy, just how I like it. I prefer New York thin, where there is an equal amount of mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce. Big River is more like St. Louis-Style pizza, where there is a higher proportion of cheese compared to tomato sauce.
The food is awesome. The only thing they need is straws with paper wrapped around them. When you reach in to get the straws you touch too many at one time. Don't like germs.

This spot is the one I like best. I go to plenty of restaurants but to this one I go the most. The crew is very professional and the food they place on your table is so flavorful. I would always prefer to have a good dinner in this place. I highly recommend this place.

Favorite. Pizza. Ever. Of all time. Hands down. Like, if you ever want to experience something magical in your life, come here. The ingredients from the veggie pizza are from the farmers market. How much better can you get?! The unique selection (I recommend the garden pizza) sets it a part from any other pizza place you will go to. Best pizza place in MN. Fight me.
The meals and service were beyond my expectations. We surely loved the atmosphere of this spot. Extraordinary spot to take the family out for lunch.
